<s> " when the king heard say that he would come into his palace, thereof had he great joy. </s>
<s>  he cometh to the queen's chamber and telleth her how the ship is arrived. </s>
<s>  the queen riseth and two of her damsels with her, and apparelleth her of a kirtle of cloth of silk, furred of ermine, and cometh into the midst of the hall. </s>
<s>  thereupon behold you, the knight that cometh all armed and the master of the ship before him bearing the twisted link of wax in the candlestick of gold in front of him, and the knight held his sword all naked. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the queen, "well may you be welcome!" "lady," saith he, "god grant you joy and good adventure. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith she, "please god we have nought to fear of you?" "lady," saith he, "no fear ought you to have!" the king seeth that he beareth the red shield with the white hart whereof he had heard tell. </s>
<s>  the brachet that was in the hall heareth the knight. </s>
<s>  he cometh racing toward him and leapeth about his legs and maketh great joy of him. </s>
<s>  and the knight playeth with him, then taketh the shield that hung at the column, and hangeth the other there, and cometh back thereafter toward the door of the hall. </s>
<s>  "lady," saith the king, "pray the knight that he go not so hastily. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the knight, "no leisure have i to abide, but at some time shall you see me again. </s>
<s> " the knights also say as much, and the king and queen are right heavy of his departure, but they durst not press him beyond his will. </s>
<s>  he is entered into the ship, and the brachet with him. </s>
<s>  the master draweth the boat within, and so they depart and leave the castle behind. </s>
<s>  king arthur abideth at pannenoisance, and is right sorrowful of the knight, that he hath gone his way so soon. </s>
<s>  the knights arose throughout the castle when the day waxed light, and learnt the tidings of the knight that had borne the shield thence, and were right grieved for that they had not seen him. </s>
<s>  the damsel that had asked the boon cometh to the king. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "did you speak of my business to the knight?" "damsel," saith the king, "never a whit! to my sorrow, for he hath departed sooner than i would!" "sir," saith she, "you have done a wrong and a sin,  please god, so good a king as are you shall not fail of his covenants to damsel so forlorn as am i. </s>
<s> " the king was right sorrowful for that he had remembered not the damsel. </s>
<s>  she departeth from the court, and taketh leave of the king and queen, and saith that she herself will go seek the knight, and that, so she may find him, she will hold the king quit of his covenant. </s>
<s>  messire gawain and lancelot are returned to the court, and have heard the tidings of the knight that hath carried away the shield, and are right grieved that they have not seen him, and messire gawain more than enough, for that he had lien in his mother's house. </s>
<s>  lancelot seeth the shield that he had left on the column, and knoweth it well, and saith, "now know i well that perceval hath been here, for this shield was he wont to bear, and the like also his father bore. </s>

<s>  and i was with him at the house of king hermit a long space until that i was healed. </s>

<s> " "lords," saith the king, "behoveth you go on quest of him or i will go, for i am bound to beseech his aid on behalf of a damsel that asked me thereof, but she told me that, so she might find him first, i should be quit of her request. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the queen, "you will do a right great service and you may counsel her herein, for sore discounselled is she. </s>
<s>  she hath told me that she was daughter of alain li gros of the valleys of camelot, and that her mother's name is yglais, and her own dindrane. </s>
<s> " "ha, lady," saith messire gawain, "she is sister to the knight that hath borne away the shield, for i lay at her mother's house wherein i was right well lodged. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith the queen, "it may well be, for so soon as she came in hither. </s>
<s>  the brachet that would have acquaintance with none, made her great joy, and when the knight came to seek the shield, the brachet, that had remained in the hall, played gladly with him and went " "by my faith," saith messire gawain, "i will go in quest of the knight, for right great desire have i to see him. </s>
<s> " "and i," saith lancelot, "never so glad have i been to see him aforetime as! should be now. </s>
<s> " "howsoever it be," saith the king, "i pray you so speed my business that the damsel shall not be able to plain her of me. </s>
<s> " v. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith lancelot, "we will tell him and we may find him, that his sister is gone in quest of him, and that she hath been at your court. </s>
<s> " the two knights depart from the court to enter on the quest of the good knight, and leave the castle far behind them and ride in the midst of a high forest until they find a cross in the midst of a launde, there where all the roads of the forest join together. </s>
<s>  "lancelot," saith messire gawain, "choose which road soever you will, and so let each go by himself, so that we may the sooner hear tidings of the good knight, and let us meet together again at this cross at the end of a year and let either tell other how he hath sped, for please god in one place or another we shall hear tidings of him. </s>
<s> " lancelot taketh the way to the right, and messire gawain to the left. </s>
<s>  therewithal they depart and commend them one another to god. </s>
<s>  branch xiii. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  here the story is silent of lancelot, and saith that messire gawain goeth a great pace riding, and prayeth god that he will so counsel him that he may find the knight. </s>
<s>  he rideth until the day cometh to decline, and he lay in the house of a hermit in the forest, that lodged him well. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the hermit to messire gawain, "whom do you go seek?" "sir," saith he, "i am in quest of a knight that i would see right gladly. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the hermit, "in this neighbourhood will you find no knight. </s>
<s> " "wherefore not?" saith messire gawain, "be there no knights in this country?" "there was wont to be plenty," saith the hermit, "but now no longer are there any, save one all alone in a castle and one all alone on the sea that have chased away and slain all the others. </s>
<s> " "and who is the one of the sea?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the hermit, "i know not who he is, save only that the sea is hard by here, where the ship runneth oftentimes wherein the knight is, and he repaireth to an island that is under the castle of the queen of the maidens, from whence he chased an uncle of his that warred upon the castle, and the other knights that he had chased thence and slain were helping his uncle, so that now the castle is made sure. </s>
<s>  and the knights that might flee from this forest and this kingdom durst not repair thither for the knight, for they dread his hardiment and his great might, sith that they know well they might not long endure against him. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith messire gawain, "is it so long a space sithence that he hath haunted the sea?" "sir," saith the hermit, "it is scarce more than a twelvemonth. </s>
<s> " "and how nigh is this to the sea?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the hermit, "it is not more than two leagues welsh. </s>
<s>  when i have gone forth to my toil, many a time have i seen the ship run close by me, and the knight, all armed, within, and meseemed he was of right great comeliness, and had as passing proud a look as any lion. </s>
<s>  but i can well tell you never was knight so dreaded in this kingdom as is he. </s>
<s>  the queen of the maidens would have lost her castle ere now but for him. </s>
<s>  nor never sithence that he hath chased his uncle from the isl hath he entered the queen's castle even once, but from that time forth hath rather rowed about the sea and searched all the islands and stricken down all the proud in such sort that he is dreaded and warily avoided throughout all the kingdoms. </s>
<s>  the queen of the maidens is right sorrowful for that he cometh not to her castle, for so dear she holdeth him of very love, that and he should come and she might keep him so that he should never issue forth again, she would sooner lock him up with her there safe within. </s>
<s> " "know you. </s>
<s> " saith messire gawain, "what shield the knight beareth?" "sir," saith the hermit, "i know not now to blazon it, for nought know i of arms. </s>
<s>  three score years and more have i been in this hermitage, yet never saw i this kingdom before so dismayed as is it now. </s>
<s> " messire gawain lay the night therewithin, and departed when he had heard mass. </s>
<s>  he draweth him as nigh the sea as he may, and rideth along beside the shore and many a time draweth rein to look forth if he might see the knight's ship. </s>
<s>  but nowhere might he espy it. </s>
<s>  he hath ridden until he cometh to the castle of the queen of the maidens. </s>
<s>  when she knew that it was messire gawain, she made thereof great joy, and pointed him out the island whither perceval had repaired, and from whence he had driven his uncle. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she to messire gawain, "i plain me much of him, for never hath he been fain to enter herewithin, save the one time that he did battle with his uncle, but ever sithence hath he made repair to this island and rowed about this sea. </s>
<s> " "lady," saith messire gawain, "and whereabout may he be now?" "sir, god help me," saith she, "i know not, for i have not seen him now of a long space, and no earthly man may know his intent nor his desire, nor whitherward he may turn. </s>
<s> " messire gawain is right sorrowful for that he knoweth not where to seek him albeit he hath so late tidings of him. </s>
<s>  he lay at the castle and was greatly honoured, and on the morrow he heard mass and took leave of the queen, and rideth all armed beside the seashore, for that the hermit had told him, and the queen herself, that he goeth oftener by sea than by land. </s>
<s>  he entereth into a forest that was nigh the sea, and seeth a knight coming a great gallop as if one were chasing him to slay him. </s>
<s>  "sir knight," saith messire gawain, "whither away so fast?" "sir, i am fleeing from the knight that hath slain all the others. </s>
<s> " "and who is the knight?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "i know not who he is," saith the knight, "but and you go forward you are sure to find him. </s>
<s> " "meseemeth," saith messire gawain, "that i have seen you aforetime. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith he, "so have you! i am the knight coward that you met in the forest there where you conquered the knight of the shield party black and white, and i am man of the damsel of the car. </s>
<s>  wherefore i pray you for god's sake that you do me no hurt, for the knight that i found down yonder hath a look so fierce that i thought i was dead when i saw it. </s>
<s> " "need you fear nought of me," saith messire gawain, "for i love your damsel well. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the knight, "i would that all the other knights would say as much in respect of me, for no fear have i save for myself alone. </s>
<s> " ii. </s>
<s>  messire gawain departeth from the knight, and goeth his way amidst the forest that overshadowed the land as far as the seashore, and looketh forth from the top of a sand-hill, and seeth a knight armed on a tall destrier, and he had a shield of gold with a green cross. </s>
<s>  "ha, god," saith messire gawain, "grant that this knight may be able to tell me tidings of him i seek!" thitherward goeth he a great gallop, and saluteth him worshipfully and he him again. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith messire gawain, "can you tell me tidings of a knight that beareth a shield banded of argent and azure with a red cross?" "yea, sir," saith the knight, "that can i well. </s>
<s>  at the assembly of the knights may you find him within forty days. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith messire gawain, "where will the assembly be?" "in the red launde, where will be many a good knight. </s>
<s>  there shall you find him without fail. </s>

<s>  the knight entered thereinto and put out to sea as he had wont to do. </s>
<s>  howbeit messire gawain goeth his way toward the red launde where the assembly was to be, and desireth much the day that it shall be. </s>
<s>  he rideth until he cometh one eventide nigh to a castle that was of right fair seeming. </s>

<s>  "for that he that shall do best at the assembly of knights shall avenge this knight's death. </s>
<s> " iii. </s>
<s>  the damsel goeth her way thereupon. </s>
<s>  and messire gawain goeth to the castle that he had seen, and found none within save only one solitary knight, old and feeble, and a squire that waited upon him. </s>
<s>  howbeit, messire gawain alighteth at the castle. </s>
<s>  the vavasour lodged him well and willingly, and made his door be well shut fast and messire gawain be disarmed, and that night he showed him honour as well as he might. </s>
<s>  and when it came to the morrow and messire gawain was minded to depart thence, the vavasour saith to him, "sir you may not depart thus, for this door hath not been opened this long while save only yesterday, when i made it be opened before you, to the intent that you should meet on my behalf a certain knight that is fain to slay me, for that the king of castle mortal hath had his hold herewithin, he that warreth on the queen of the maidens. </s>
<s>  wherefore i pray you that you help me to defend it against the knight. </s>
<s> " "what shield beareth he?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "he beareth a golden shield with a green cross. </s>
<s> " "and what sort of knight is he?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the vavasour, "a good knight and a hardy and a sure. </s>
<s> " "by my faith," saith messire gawain, "and you can tell me tidings of another knight whereof i am in quest, i will protect you against this one to the best i may, and if he will do nought for my prayer, i will safeguard you of my force. </s>
<s> " "what knight, then, do you seek?" saith the vavasour. </s>
<s>  "sir, a knight that is called perceval, and he hath carried away from the court of king arthur a shield banded argent and azure with a red cross on a band of gold. </s>
<s>  he will be at the assembly in the red launde. </s>
<s>  these tidings had i of the knight you dread so much. </s>
<s> " iv. </s>
<s>  thereupon, whilst messire gawain was thus speaking to the vavasour, behold you the knight of the golden shield, that draweth rein in the midst of a launde that was betwixt the castle and the forest. </s>
<s>  the vavasour seeth him from the windows of the hall, and pointeth him out to messire gawain. </s>
<s>  messire gawain goeth and mounteth on his destrier, his shield at his neck and his spear in his fist, all armed, and issueth forth of the door when it had been unfastened, and cometh toward the knight, that awaited him on his horse. </s>
<s>  he seeth messire gawain coming, but moveth not, and messire gawain marvelleth much that the knight cometh not toward him, for him thinketh well that the vavasour had told him true. </s>
<s>  but he had not, for never had the knight come thither to do the vavasour any hurt, but on account of the knights that passed by that way that went to seek adventure, for right glad was he to see them albeit he was not minded to make himself known unto any. </s>
<s>  messire gawain looketh before him and behind him and seeth that the door was made fast and the bridge drawn up so soon as he was departed thence, whereof he marvelled much and saith to the knight, "sir, is your intent nought but good only?" "by my head," saith he, "nought at all, and readily will i tell it you. </s>
<s> " thereupon, behold you a damsel that cometh a great pace, and held a whip wherewith she hurrieth her mule onward, and she draweth rein there where the two knights were. </s>
<s>  "ha, god!" saith she, "shall i ever find one to wreak me vengeance of the traitor vavasour that dwelleth in this castle?" "is he then traitor?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "yea, sir, the most traitor you saw ever! he lodged my brother the day before yesterday, and bore him on hand at night that a certain knight was warring upon him for that the way whereby the knights pass is here in front of this place, and lied to him so much as that my brother held him in covenant that he would assault a certain knight that he should point out to him, for love of him. </s>
<s>  this knight came passing hereby, that had no thought to do hurt neither to the vavasour nor to my brother. </s>
<s>  the knight was right strong and hardy, and was born at the castle of escavalon. </s>
<s>  my brother issued forth of the castle filled with fool-hardiness for the leasing of the vavasour, and ran upon the knight without a word. </s>
<s>  the knight could do no less than avenge himself. </s>
<s>  they hurtled together so sore that their horses fell under them and their spears passed either through other's heart. </s>
<s>  thus were both twain killed on this very piece of ground. </s>
<s> " v. </s>
<s>  "the vavasour took the arms and the horses and put them in safe keeping in his castle, and the bodies of the knights he left to the wild beasts, that would have devoured them had i not chanced to come thither with two knights that helped me bury them by yonder cross at the entrance of the forest. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith messire gawain, "in like manner would he have wrought me mischief had i been minded to trust him. </s>
<s>  for he bore me in hand that this knight was warring upon him, and besought me that i should safeguard him against him. </s>
<s>  but our lord god so helped me that i intermeddled not therein, for lightly might i have wrought folly. </s>
<s> " "by the name of god," saith the other, "meseemeth it clear that the vavasour would fain that knights should kill each other. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the damsel, "you say true. </s>
<s>  it is of his covetise of harness and horses that he entreateth the knights on this-wise. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith messire gawain, "whither go you?" "sir," saith she, "after a knight that i have made be carried in a litter for the dead. </s>
<s> " "i saw him," saith he, "pass by here last night, full late last night. </s>
<s> " the knight taketh leave of messire gawain, and messire gawain saith that he holdeth himself a churl in that he hath not asked him of his name. </s>
<s>  but the knight said, "fair sir, i pray you of love that you ask not my name until such time as i shall ask you of yours. </s>
<s> " vi. </s>
<s>  messire gawain would ask nought further of the knight, and the knight entered into the lonely forest and messire gawain goeth on his way. </s>
<s>  he meeteth neither knight nor damsel to whom he telleth not whom he goeth to seek, and they all say that he will be in the red launde. </s>
<s>  he lodged the night with a hermit. </s>
<s>  at night, the hermit asked messire gawain whence he came? "sir, from the land of the queen of the maidens. </s>
<s> " "have you seen perceval, the good knight that took the shield in king arthur's court and left another there?" "no, certes," saith messire gawain, "whereof am i right sorrowful. </s>
<s>  but a knight with a shield of gold and a green cross thereon told me that he would be at the red launde. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the hermit, "you say true, for it was he himself to whom you spake. </s>
<s>  tonight is the third night since he lay within yonder, and see here the bracket he brought from king arthur's court, which he hath commanded me to convey to his uncle, king hermit. </s>
<s> " "alas!" saith messire gawain, "what ill chance is mine if this be true!" "sir," saith the hermit, "i ought not to lie, neither to you nor other. </s>
<s>  by the brachet may you well know that this is true. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith messire gawain, "of custom beareth he no such shield. </s>
<s> " "i know well," saith the hermit, "what shield he ought to bear, and what shield he will bear hereafter. </s>
<s>  but this doth he that he may not be known, and this shield took he in the hermitage of joseus, the son of king hermit, there where lancelot was lodged, where he hanged the four thieves that would have broken into the hermitage by night. </s>
<s>  and within there hath remained the shield he brought from king arthur's court, with joseus the son of my sister, and they are as brother and sister between the twain, and you may know of very truth that albeit joseus be hermit, no knight is there in great britain of his heart and hardiment. </s>
<s> " vii. </s>
<s>  "certes," saith messire gawain, "it was sore mischance for me that i should see him yesterday before the castle where the knights pass by, and speak to him and ask him his name, but he besought me that i should not ask him his name until such time as he should ask me mine. </s>
<s>  and with that he departed from me and entered into the forest, and i came hitherward. </s>
<s>  now am i so sorrowful that i know not what i may do for the best, for king arthur sendeth me in quest of him, and lancelot hath also gone to seek him in another part of the kingdom of logres. </s>
<s>  but now hath too great mischance befallen me of this quest, for twice have i seen him and found him and spoken to him, and now have i lost him again. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the hermit, "he is so close and wary a knight, that he is fain never to waste a word, neither will he make false semblant to any nor speak word that he would not should be heard, nor do shame of his body to his knowledge, nor carnal sin, for virgin and chaste is he and doth never outrage to any. </s>
<s> " "i know well," saith messire gawain, "that all the valours and all the cleannesses that ought to be in a knight are in him, and therefore am i the more sorrowful that i am not of them that he knoweth, for a man is worth the more that hath acquaintance with a good knight. </s>
<s> " viii. </s>
<s>  messire gawain lay the night in the hermit's house, right sorrowful, and in the morning departed when he had heard mass. </s>
<s>  josephus the good clerk witnesseth us in this high history that this hermit had to name josuias, and was a knight of great worship and valour, but he renounced all for the love of god, and was fain to set his body in banishment for him. </s>
<s>  and all these adventures that you hear in this high record came to pass, josephus telleth us, for the setting forward the law of the saviour. </s>
<s>  all of them could he not record, but only these whereof he best remembered him, and whereof he knew for certain all the adventures by virtue of the holy spirit. </s>
<s>  this high record saith that messire gawain hath wandered so far that he is come into the red launde whereas the assembly of knights should be held. </s>
<s>  he looketh and seeth the tents pitched and the knights coming from all quarters. </s>
<s>  the most part were already armed within and before their tents. </s>
<s>  messire gawain looketh everywhere, thinking to see the knight he seeketh, but seemeth him he seeth him not, for no such shield seeth he as he beareth. </s>
<s>  all abashed is he thereof, for he hath seen all the tents and looked at all the arms. </s>
<s>  but the knight is not easy to recognise, for he hath changed his arms, and nigh enough is he to messire gawain, albeit you may well understand that he knoweth it not. </s>
<s>  and the tournament assembleth from all parts, and the divers fellowships come the one against other, and the melly of either upon other as they come together waxeth sore and marvellous. </s>
<s>  and messire gawain searcheth the ranks to find the knight, albeit when he meeteth knight in his way he cannot choose but do whatsoever a knight may do of arms, and yet more would he have done but for his fainness to seek out the knight. </s>
<s>  the damsel is at the head of the tournament, for that she would fain know the one that shall have the mastery and the prize therein. </s>
<s>  the knight that messire gawain seeketh is not at the head of the fellowships, but in the thickest of the press, and such feats of arms doth he that more may no knight do, and smiteth down the knights about him, that flee from him even as the deer-hound fleeth from the lion. </s>
<s>  "by my faith," saith messire gawain, "sith that they have lied to me about the knight, i will seek him no more this day, but forget my discontent as best i may until evening. </s>
<s> " he seeth the knight, but knoweth him not, for he had a white shield and cognisances of the same. </s>
<s>  and messire gawain cometh to him as fast as his horse may carry him, and the knight toward messire gawain. </s>
<s>  so passing stoutly they come together that they pierce their shields below the boss. </s>
<s>  their spears were so tough that they break not, and they draw them forth and come together again so strongly that the spears wherewith they smote each other amidst the breast were bended so that they unriveted the holdfasts of their shields, and they lost their stirrups, and the reins fly from their fists, and they stagger against the back saddlebows, and the horses stumbled so as that they all but fell. </s>
<s>  they straighten them in saddle and stirrup, and catch hold upon their reins, and then come together again, burning with wrath and fury like lions, and either smiteth on other with their spears that may endure no longer, for the shafts are all to-frushed as far as the fists in such sort that they that look on marvel them much how it came to pass that the points had not pierced their bodies. </s>
<s>  but god would not that the good knights should slay each other, rather would he that the one should know the true worth of the other. </s>
<s>  the habergeons safeguarded not their bodies, but the might of god in whom they believed, for in them had they all the valour that knight should have. </s>
<s>  and never did messire gawain depart from hostel wherein he had lien, but he first heard mass before he went if so he might, nor never found he dame nor damsel discounselled whereof he had not pity, nor did he ever churlishness to other knight, nor said nor thought it, and he came, as you have heard, of the most holy lineage of josephus and the good king fisherman. </s>
<s>  ix. </s>
<s>  the good knights were in the midst of the assembly, and right wrathful was the one against the other, and they held their swords naked and their shields on their arms and dealt each other huge buffets right in the midst of the helms. </s>
<s>  the most part of the knights come to them and tell them that the assembly waiteth for them to come thereunto. </s>
<s>  they have much pains to part them asunder, and then the melly beginneth again on all sides, and the evening cometh on that parteth them at last. </s>
<s>  and on this wise the assembly lasted for two days. </s>
<s>  the damsel that brought the knight on a bier in a coffin, dead, prayed the assembly of all the knights to declare which one of all the knights had done the best, for the knight that she made be carried might not be buried until such time as he were avenged. </s>
<s>  and they say that the knight of the white shield and the other with the shield sinople and the golden eagle had done better than all the other,  for that the knight of the white shield had joined in the melly before the other, they therefore would give him the prize. </s>
<s>  but they judged that for the time that messire gawain had joined therein he had not done worse than the other knight. </s>
<s>  the damsel seeketh the knight of the white shield among the knights and throughout all the tents, but cannot find him, for already hath he departed. </s>
<s>  she cometh to messire gawain and saith: "sir, sith that i find not the knight of the white shield, you are he that behoveth avenge the knight that lieth dead in the litter. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith messire gawain, "do me not this shame, for it hath been declared that the other knight hath better done herein than i. </s>
<s> " x. </s>
<s>  "damsel, well you know that no honour should i have thereof, were i to emprise to do that whereof you beseech me, ~for you have said that behoveth none to avenge him, save only that hath borne him best at this assembly, and that is he of the white shield,  so god help me, this have i well felt and proven. </s>
<s> " xi. </s>
<s>  the damsel well understandeth that messire gawain speaketh reason. </s>
<s>  "ha, sir," saith she, "he hath already departed hence and gone into the forest, and the most divers-seeming knight is he and the best that liveth, and great pains shall i have or ever i find him again. </s>
<s> " "the best?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "how know you that?" "i know it well," saith she, "for that in the house of king fisherman did the graal appear unto him for the goodness of his knighthood and the goodness of his heart and for the chastity of his body. </s>
<s>  but he forgat to ask that one should serve thereof, whence hath sore harm befallen the land. </s>
<s>  he came to the court of king arthur, where he took a shield that none ought to bear save he alone. </s>
<s>  up to this time have i well known his coming and going, but nought shall i know thereof hereafter for that he hath changed the cognisance of his shield and arms. </s>
<s>  and now am i entered into sore pain and travail to seek him, for i shall not have found him of a long space, and i came not to this assembly save for him alone. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith messire gawain, "you have told me tidings such as no gladness have i thereof, for i also am seeking him, but i know not how i may ever recognise him, for he willeth not to tell me his name, and too often changeth he his shield, and well i know that so i shall ever come in place where he hath changed his cognisance, and he shall come against me and i against him, i shall only know him by the buffets that he knoweth how to deal, for never in arms have i made acquaintance with so cruel a knight. </s>
<s>  but again would i suffer sorer blows than i have suffered yet, so only i might be where he is. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the damsel, "what is your name?" "damsel," saith he, "i am called gawain. </s>
<s> " with that he commendeth the damsel to god, and goeth his way in one direction and the damsel in another, and saith to herself that perceval is the most marvellous knight of the world, that so often he discogniseth himself. </s>
<s>  for when one seeth him one may recognise him not. </s>
<s>  messire gawain rideth amidst the forest, and prayeth the saviour lead him into such place as that he may find perceval openly, in such sort that he may have his acquaintance and his love that so greatly he desireth. </s>
<s>  branch xiv. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  herewithal the story is silent of messire gawain, and saith that lancelot seeketh perceval in like manner as did messire gawain, and rideth until that he cometh to the hermitage where he hanged the thieves. </s>
<s>  joseus made right great joy of him. </s>
<s>  he asked him whether he knew any tidings of the son of the widow lady. </s>
<s>  "i have seen him sithence that he came from king arthur's court but once only, and whither he is gone i know not. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith lancelot, "i would see him right fain. </s>
<s>  king arthur sendeth for him by me. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the hermit, "i know not when i may see him again, for when once he departeth hence he is not easy to find. </s>
<s> " lancelot entereth the chapel with the hermit, and seeth the shield that perceval brought from king arthur's court beside the altar. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith lancelot, "i see his shield yonder. </s>
<s>  hide him not from me. </s>
<s> " "i will not do so," saith the hermit. </s>
<s>  "this shield, truly, is his, but he took with him another from hence, of gold with a green cross. </s>
<s> " "and know you no tidings of messire gawain?" "i have not seen messire gawain sithence tofore i entered into this hermitage. </s>
<s>  but you have fallen into sore hatred on account of the four robbers that were knights whom you hanged. </s>
<s>  for their kinsmen are searching for you in this forest and in other, and are thieves like as were the others, and they have their hold in this forest, wherein they bestow their robberies and plunder. </s>
<s>  wherefore i pray you greatly be on your guard against them. </s>
<s> " "so will i," saith lancelot, "please god. </s>
<s> " he lay the night in the hermitage, and departeth on the morrow after that he hath heard mass and prayeth god grant he may find perceval or messire gawain. </s>
<s>  he goeth his way amidst the strange forests until that he cometh to a strong castle that was builded right seemly. </s>
<s>  he looketh before him and seeth a knight that was issued thereout, and was riding a great pace on a strong destrier, and carded a bird on his fist toward the forest. </s>
<s>  ii. </s>
<s>  when he saw lancelot coming he drew up. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith he, "be welcome. </s>
<s> " "good adventure to you," saith lancelot. </s>
<s>  "what castle is this?" "sir, it is the castle of the golden circlet. </s>
<s>  and i go to meet the knights and dames that come to the castle, for this day is the day ordained for the adoration of the golden circlet. </s>
<s> " "what is the golden circlet?" saith lancelot. </s>
<s>  "sir, it is the crown of thorns," saith the knight, "that the saviour of the world had on his head when he was set upon the rood. </s>
<s>  wherefore the queen of this castle hath set it in gold and precious stones in such sort that the knights and dames of this kingdom come to behold it once in the year. </s>
<s>  but it is said that the knight that was first at the graal shall conquer it, and therefore is no strange knight allowed to enter. </s>
<s>   so please you, i will lead you to mine own hold that is in this forest. </s>
<s> " "right great thanks," saith lancelot, "but as yet it is not time to take lodging. </s>
<s> " he taketh leave of the knight, and so departeth and looketh at the castle, and saith that in right great worship should the knight be held that by the valour of his chivalry shall conquer so noble a hallow as is the golden circlet when it is kept safe in a place so strong. </s>
<s>  he goeth his way right amidst the forest, and looketh forth before him and seeth coming the damsel that hath the knight carried in the litter for the dead. </s>
<s>  "damsel," saith lancelot, "be welcome. </s>
<s> " "sir, god give you good adventure! sir," saith the damsel, "greatly ought i to hate the knight that slew this knight, for that he hath forced me thus to lead him in this wise by fell and forest. </s>
<s>  so also ought i to mislike me much of the knight that it standeth upon to avenge him, whom i may not find. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith lancelot, "who slew this knight?" "sir," saith she, "the lord of the burning dragon. </s>
<s> " "and who ought of right to avenge him?" "sir," saith she, "the knight that was in the red launde at the assembly, that jousted with messire gawain, and had the prize of the tournament. </s>
<s> " "did he better than messire gawain?" saith lancelot. </s>
<s>  "sir, so did they adjudge him. </s>
<s>  for that he was a longer time in the assembly. </s>
<s> " "a good knight was he, then," saith lancelot, "sith that he did better than messire gawain!" "by my head," saith the damsel, "you say true, for he is the best knight of the world. </s>
<s> " "and what shield beareth he?" saith lancelot. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the damsel, "at the assembly he bore white arms, but before that, he had arms of another semblance, and one shield that he had was green, and one gold with a green cross. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith he, "did messire gawain know him?" "sir, not at all, whereof is he right sorrowful. </s>
<s> " "is he, then," saith he, "perceval, the son of the widow lady?" "by my head, you say true!" "ha, god!" saith lancelot, "the more am i mazed how messire gawain knew him not. </s>
<s>  damsel," saith he, "and know you whitherward they are gone?" "sir," saith she, "i know not whither, nor have i any tidings, neither or the one nor the other. </s>
<s> " he departeth from the damsel and rideth until the sun was set. </s>
<s>  he found the rocks darkling and the forest right deep and perilous of seeming. </s>
<s>  he rode on, troubled in thought, and weary and full of vexation. </s>
<s>  many a time looketh he to right and to left, and he may see any place where he may lodge. </s>
<s>  a dwarf espied him, but lancelot saw him not. </s>
<s>  the dwarf goeth right along a by-way that is in the forest, and goeth to a little hold of robber-knights that lay out of the way, where was a damsel that kept watch over the hold. </s>
<s>  the robbers had another hold where was the damsel where the passing knights are deceived and entrapped. </s>
<s>  the dwarf cometh forthright to the damsel, and saith: "now shall we see what you will do, for see, here cometh the knight that hanged your uncle grid your three cousins german. </s>
<s> " "now shall i have the best of him," saith she, "as for mine own share in this matter, but take heed that you be garnished ready to boot. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith the dwarf, "that will i, for, please god, he shall not escape us again, save he be dead. </s>
<s> " the damsel was of passing great beauty and was clad right seemingly, but right treacherous was she of heart, nor no marvel was it thereof, for she came of the lineage of robbers and was nurtured on theft and robbery, and she herself had helped to murder many a knight. </s>
<s>  she is come upon the way, so that lancelot hath to pass her, without her kerchief. </s>
<s>  she meeteth lancelot and saluteth him and maketh him right great joy, of semblant. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "follow this path that goeth into the forest, and you will find a hold that my forefathers stablished for harbouring of such knights as might be passing through the forest. </s>
<s>  the night is dark already, and if you pass on further no hold will you find nearer than a score leagues welsh. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith lancelot, "gramercy heartily of this that it pleaseth you to say, for right gladly will i harbour me here, for it is more than time to take lodging, and with you more willingly than another. </s>
<s> " iii. </s>
<s>  on this wise they go their way talking, as far as the hold. </s>
<s>  there was none therewithin save only the dwarf, for the five robber knights were in their hold at the lower end of the forest. </s>
<s>  the dwarf took lancelot's horse, and stabled him, then went up into the hall above, and gave himself up wholly to serving him. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the damsel, "allow yourself to be disarmed, and have full assurance of safety. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith he, "small trouble is it for me to wear mine arms, and lightly may i abide it. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith she, "please god, you shall nor lie armed within yonder. </s>
<s>  never yet did knight so that harboured therein. </s>
<s> " but the more the damsel presseth him to disarm, the more it misliketh him, for the place seemeth him right dark and foul-seeming, wherefore will he not disarm nor disgarnish himself. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "meseemeth you are suspicious of something, but no call have you to misdoubt of aught here within, for the place is quite safe. </s>
<s>  i know not whether you have enemies?" "damsel," saith lancelot, "never yet knew i knight that was loved of everybody, yet sometimes might none tell the reason thereof. </s>
<s> " iv. </s>
<s>  lancelot, so saith the story, would not disarm him, wherefore he made the table be set, and sate thereat beside the damsel at meat. </s>
<s>  he made his shield and his helmet and spear be brought into the hall. </s>
<s>  he leant back upon a rich couch that was therewithin, with his sword by his side, all armed. </s>
<s>  he was weary and the bed was soft, so he went to sleep. </s>
<s>  howbeit, the dwarf mounteth on his horse that he had left still saddled, and goeth his way to the other hold where the robbers were, all five, that were lancelot's mortal enemies. </s>
<s>  the damsel remained all alone with him that she hated of a right deadly hate. </s>
<s>  she thought to herself that gladly would she slay him, and that, so she might compass it, she would be thereof held in greater worship of all the world, for well she knew that he was a good knight, and that one so good she had never slain. </s>
<s>  she filched away the sword that was at his side, then drew it from the scabbard, then looketh to see where she may lightliest smite him to slay him. </s>
<s>  she seeth that his head is so covered of armour that nought appeareth thereof save only the face, and she bethinketh her that one stroke nor two on the helmet would scarce hurt him greatly, but that and she might lift the skirt of his habergeon without awakening him she might well slay him, for so might she thrust the sword right through his heart. </s>
<s>  meanwhile, as she was searching thus, lancelot, that was sleeping and took no heed thereof, saw, so it seemed him, a little cur-dog come therewithin, and brought with him sundry great mongrel ban-dogs that ran upon him on all sides, and the little cur bit at him likewise among the others. </s>
<s>  the ban-dogs held him so fast that he might not get away from them. </s>
<s>  he seeth that a greyhound bitch had hold of his sword, and she had hands like a woman, and was fain to slay him. </s>
<s>  and it seemed him that he snatched the sword from her and slew the greyhound bitch and the biggest and most masterful of the ban-dogs and the little cur. </s>
<s>  he was scared of the dream and started up and awoke, and felt the scabbard of his sword by his side, that the damsel had left there all empty, the which he perceived not, and soon thereafter he fell on sleep again. </s>
<s>  the dwarf that had stolen his horse cometh to the robber knights, and crieth to them, "up, sirs, and haste you to come and avenge you of your mortal enemy that sent the best of your kindred out of the world with such shame! see, here is his horse that i bring you for a token!" he alighteth of the horse, and giveth him up to them. </s>
<s>  right joyous are the robbers of the tidings he telleth them. </s>
<s>  the dwarf bringeth them all armed to the hold. </s>
<s>  v. </s>
<s>  lancelot was awake, all scared of the dream he had dreamed. </s>
<s>  he seeth them enter within all armed, and the damsel crieth to them: "now will it appear," saith she, "what you will do!" lancelot hath leapt up, thinking to take his sword, but findeth the scabbard all empty. </s>
<s>  the damsel that held the sword was the first of all to run upon him, and the five knights and the dwarf set upon him from every side. </s>
<s>  he perceived that it was his own sword the damsel held, the one he prized above all other. </s>
<s>  he taketh his lance that was at his bed's head and cometh toward the master of the knights at a great sweep, and smiteth him so fiercely that he thrusteth him right through the body so that the lance passeth a fathom beyond, and beareth him to the ground dead. </s>
<s>  his spear broke as he drew it back. </s>
<s>  he runneth to the damsel that held the sword, and wresteth it forth of her hands and holdeth it fast with his arm right against his flank and grippeth it to him right strait. </s>
<s>  albeit she would fain snatch it again from him by force, whereat lancelot much marvelled. </s>
<s>  he swingeth it above him, and the four knights come back upon him. </s>
<s>  he thinketh to smite one with the sword, when the damsel leapeth in between them, thinking to hold lancelot fast, and thereby the blow that should have fallen on one of the knights caught the damsel right through the head and slew her, whereof he was right sorrowful, howsoever she might have wrought against him. </s>
<s>  vi. </s>
<s>  when the four knights saw the damsel dead, right grieved were they thereof. </s>
<s>  and the dwarf crieth out to them: "lords, now shall it be seen how you will avenge the sore mischief done you. </s>
<s>  so help me god, great shame may you have and you cannot conquer a single knight. </s>
<s> " they run upon him again on all sides, but maugre all their heads he goeth thither where he thinketh to find his horse. </s>
<s>  but him findeth he not. </s>
<s>  thereby well knoweth he that the dwarf hath made away with him, wherefore he redoubled his hardiment and his wrath waxed more and more. </s>
<s>  and the knights were not to be lightly apaid when they saw their lord dead and the damsel that was their cousin. </s>
<s>  sore buffets they dealt him of their swords the while he defended himself as best he might. </s>
<s>  he caught the dwarf that was edging them on to do him hurt, and clave him as far as the shoulders, and wounded two of the knights right badly, and he himself was hurt in two places. </s>
<s>  but he might not depart from the house, nor was his horse there within, nor was there but a single entrance into the hall. </s>
<s>  the knights set themselves without the door and guard the issue, and lancelot was within with them that were dead. </s>
<s>  he sate himself down at the top of the hall to rest him, for he was sore spent with the blows he had given and received. </s>
<s>  when he had rested himself awhile, he riseth to his feet and seeth that they have sate them down in the entrance to the hall. </s>
<s>  he mounteth up to the windows and flingeth them down them that were dead within through the windows. </s>
<s>  just then the day appeared, fair and clear, and the birds began to sing amidst the forest, whereof the hall was overshadowed. </s>
<s>  he maketh fast the door of the hall and barreth it and shutteth the knights without. </s>
<s>  and they say one to the other and swear it, that they will not depart thence until they have taken him or famished him to death. </s>
<s>  little had lancelot recked of their threats and he might have had his horse at will, but he was not so sure of his stroke afoot as a-horseback, as no knight never is. </s>
<s>  him thinketh he may well abide the siege as long as god shall please, for the hall was well garnished of meat in right great joints. </s>
<s>  he is there within all alone, and the four knights without that keep watch that he goeth not, but neither wish nor will hath he to go forth afoot. </s>
<s>   and he had had his horse, the great hardiment that he hath in him would have made that he should go forth honourably, howsoever they without might have taken it and what grievance soever they might have had thereof. </s>
<s>  branch xv. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  here the story is silent of lancelot, and talketh of messire gawain that goeth to seek perceval, and is right heavy for that twice hath he found him when he knew him not. </s>
<s>  he cometh back again to the cross whereas he told lancelot he would await him so he should come thither before him. </s>
<s>  he went and came to and fro by the forest more than eight days to wait for him, but could hear no tidings. </s>
<s>  he would not return to king arthur's court, for had he gone thither in such case, he would have had blame thereof. </s>
<s>  he goeth back upon the quest and saith that he will never stint therein until he shall have found both lancelot and perceval. </s>
<s>  he cometh to the hermitage of joseus, and alighted of his horse and found the young hermit joseus, that received him well and made full great joy of him. </s>
<s>  he harboured the night therewithin. </s>
<s>  messire gawain asked him tidings of perceval, and the hermit telleth him he hath not seen him since before the assembly of the red launde. </s>
<s>  "and can you tell me where i may find him?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "not i," saith the hermit, "i cannot tell you whereabout he is. </s>
<s> " while they were talking on this wise, straightway behold you a knight coming that hath arms of azure, and alighteth at the hermitage to lodge there. </s>
<s>  the hermit receiveth him right gladly. </s>
<s>  messire gawain asketh him if he saw a knight with white arms ride amidst the forest. </s>
<s>  "by my faith," saith the knight, "i have seen him this day and spoken with him, and he asked me and i could tell him tidings of a knight that beareth a shield of sinople with a golden eagle, and i told him, no. </s>
<s>  afterward, i enquired wherefore he asked it, and he made answer that he had jousted at him in the red launde, nor never before had he found so sturdy assault of any knight, wherefore he was right sorrowful for that he was not acquainted with him, for the sake of his good knighthood. </s>
<s> " "by my faith," saith gawain, "the knight is more sorrowful than he, for nought is there in the world he would gladlier see than him. </s>
<s> " the knight espieth messire gawain's shield and saith, "ha, sir, methinketh you are he. </s>
<s> " "certes," saith messire gawain, "you say true. </s>
<s>  i am he against whom he jousted, and right glad am i that so good a knight smote upon my shield, and right sorrowful for that i knew him not. </s>
<s>  but tell me where i may find him?" ii. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith joseus the hermit, "he will not have gone forth from this forest, for this is the place wherein he wonneth most willingly, and the shield that he brought from king arthur's court is in this chapel. </s>
<s> " so he showeth the shield to messire gawain that maketh great joy thereof. </s>
<s>  "ha, sir," saith the knight of the white arms, "is your name messire gawain?" "fair sir," saith he, "gawain am i called. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the knight, "i have not ceased to seek you for a long while past. </s>
<s>  meliot of logres, that is your man, the son of the lady that was slain on your account, sendeth you word that nabigant of the rock hath slain his father on your account. </s>
<s>  wherefore he challengeth the land that hath fallen to him. </s>
<s>  and hereof he prayeth you that you will come to succour him as behoveth lord to do to his liege man. </s>
<s> " "by my faith," saith messire gawain, "behoveth me not fail him therein, wherefore tell him i will succour him so soon as i may. </s>
<s>  but tell him i have emprised a business that i cannot leave but with loss of honour until such time as it be achieved. </s>
<s> " they lay the night at the hermitage until after mass was sung on the morrow. </s>
<s>  iii. </s>
<s>  the knight departed and messire gawain remained. </s>
<s>  so when he was apparelled to mount, he looketh before him at the issue of the forest toward the hermitage, and seeth coming a knight on a tall horse, full speed and all armed, and he bore a shield like the one he saw perceval bearing the first time. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith he, "know you this knight that cometh there!" "truly, sir, well do i know him. </s>
<s>  this is perceval whom you seek, whom you so much desire to see!" "god be praised thereof!" saith messire gawain, "inasmuch as he cometh hither. </s>
<s> " he goeth afoot to meet him, and perceval alighteth so soon as he seeth him. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith messire gawain, "right welcome may you be!" "good joy may you have," saith perceval. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the hermit, "make great joy of him! this is messire gawain, king arthur's nephew. </s>
<s> " "thereof do i love him the better!" saith he. </s>
<s>  "honour and joy ought all they to do him that know him!" he throweth his arms on his neck, and so maketh him great joy. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith he, "can you tell me tidings of a knight that was in the red launde at the assembly of knights?" "what shield beareth he?" saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "a red shield with a golden eagle," saith perceval. </s>
<s>  "and more by token, never made i acquaintance with any so sturdy in battle as are he and lancelot. </s>
<s> " "fair sir, it pleaseth you to say so," saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "in the red launde was i at the assembly, and such arms bore i as these you blazon, and i jousted against a knight in white arms, of whom i know this, that all of knighthood that may be lodged in the body of a man is in him. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith perceval to messire gawain, "you know not how to blame any man. </s>
<s> " so they hold one another by the hands, and go into the hermitage. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith messire gawain, "when you were in the court of king arthur for the shield that is within yonder, your sister was also there, and prayed and besought the help of the knight that should bear away the shield, as being the most discounselled damsel in the world. </s>
<s>  the king granted it her, and you bore away the shield. </s>
<s>  she asked your aid of the king as she that deemed not you were her brother, and said that if the king failed of his covenant, he would do great sin, whereof would he have much blame. </s>
<s>  the king was fain to do all he might to seek you, to make good that he had said, and sent us forth in quest of you, so that the quest lieth between me and lancelot. </s>
<s>  he himself would have come had we been unwilling to go. </s>
<s>  sir, i have found you three times without knowing you, albeit great desire had i to see you. </s>
<s>  this is the fourth time and i know you now, whereof i make myself right joyous. </s>
<s>  and much am i beholden to you of the fair lodging your mother gave me at camelot. </s>
<s>  but right sore pity have i of her, for a right worshipful woman is she, and a widow lady and ancient, and fallen into much war without aid nor comfort, through the evil folk that harass her and reave her of her castles. </s>
<s>  she prayed me, weeping the while right sweetly, that and if i should find you that are her son, i should tell you of her plight, that your father is dead, and that she hath no succour nor aid to look for save from you alone, and if you succour her not shortly, she will lose her own one castle that she holdeth, and must needs become a beggar, for of the fifteen castles she wont to have in your father's time, she hath now only that of camelot, nor of all her knights hath she but five to guard the castle. </s>
<s>  wherefore i pray you on her behalf and for your own honour, that you will grant her herein of your counsel and your valour and your might, for of no chivalry that you may do may you rise to greater worship. </s>
<s>  and so sore need hath she herein as you hear me tell, nor would i that she should lose aught by default of message, for thereof should i have sin and she harm, and you yourself also, that have the power to amend it and ought of right so to do!" "well have you delivered yourself herein," saith perceval, "and betimes will i succour her and our lord god will. </s>
<s> " "you will do honour to yourself," saith messire gawain. </s>
<s>  "thereof will you have praise with god and worship with the world. </s>
<s> " "well know i," saith perceval, "that in me ought she to have aid and counsel as of right, and that so i do not accordingly, i ought to have reproach and be blamed as recreant before the world. </s>
<s> " iv. </s>
<s>  "in god's name," saith the hermit, "you speak according to the scripture, for he that honoureth not his father and mother neither believeth in god nor loveth him. </s>
<s> " "all this know i well," saith perceval, "and well pleased am i to be reminded thereof, and well know i also mine intent herein, albeit i tell it to none. </s>
<s>  but if any can tell me tidings of lancelot, right willingly shall i hear them, and take it kindly of the teller thereof. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith joseus, "it is but just now since he lay here within, and asked me tidings of messire gawain, and i told him such as i knew. </s>
<s>  another time before that, he lay here when the robbers assailed us that he hanged in the forest, and so hated is he thereof of their kinsfolk that and they may meet him, so they have the might, he is like to pay for it right dear, and in this forest won they rather than in any other. </s>
<s>  i told him as much, but he made light thereof in semblant, even as he will in deed also if their force be not too great. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith perceval, "i will not depart forth of this forest until i know tidings of him, if messire gawain will pledge himself thereto. </s>
<s> " and messire saith he desireth nothing better, sith that he hath found perceval, for he may not be at ease until such time as he shall know tidings of lancelot, for he hath great misgiving sith that he hath enemies in the forest. </s>
<s>  v. </s>
<s>  perceval and messire gawain sojourned that day in the forest in the hermitage, and the morrow perceval took his shield that he brought from king arthur's court, and left that which he brought with him, and messire gawain along with him that made himself right joyous of his company. </s>
<s>  they ride amidst the forest both twain, all armed, and at the right hour of noon they meet a knight that was coming a great gallop as though he were all scared. </s>
<s>  perceval asketh him whence he cometh, that he seemeth so a-dread. </s>
<s>  "sir, i come from the forest of the robbers that won in this forest wherethrough you have to pass. </s>
<s>  they have chased me a full league welsh to slay me, but they would not follow me further for a knight that they have beset in one of their holds, that hath done them right sore mischief, for he hath hanged four of their knights and slain one, as well as the fairest damsel that was in the kingdom. </s>
<s>  but right well had she deserved the death for that she harboured knights with fair semblant and showed them much honour, and afterward brought about their death and destruction, between herself and a dwarf that she hath, that slew the knights. </s>
<s> " "and know you who is the knight?" saith perceval. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the knight, "not i, for no leisure had i to ask him, for sorer need had i to flee than to stay. </s>
<s>  but i tell you that on account of the meat that failed him in the hold wherein they beset him, he issued forth raging like a lion, nor would he have suffered himself be shut up so long but for two wounds that he had upon his body. </s>
<s>  for he cared not to issue forth of the house until such time as they were healed, and also for that he had no horse. </s>
<s>  and so soon as he felt himself whole, he ventured himself against the four knights, that were so a-dread of him that they durst not come a-nigh. </s>
<s>  and moreover he deigneth not to go a-foot, wherefore if they now come a-nigh, it may not be but he shall have one at least out of their four horses, but they hold them heedfully aloof. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith perceval,"gramercy of these tidings. </s>
<s> " they were fain to depart from the knight, but said he: "ha, lords, allow me so much as to see the destruction of this evil folk that have wrought such mischief in this forest! sir" saith he to messire gawain, "i am cousin to the poor knight of the waste forest that hath the two poor damsels to sister, there where you and lancelot jousted between you, and when the knight that brought you tidings thereof died in the night. </s>
<s> " "by my faith," saith messire gawain, "these tidings know i well, for you say true, and your company hold i right dear for the love of the poor knight, for never yet saw i more courteous knight, nor more courteous damsels, nor better nurtured, and our lord god grant them as much good as i would they should have. </s>
<s> " messire gawain made the knight go before, for well knew he the robbers' hold, but loath enough had he been to go thither, had the knights not followed him behind. </s>
<s>  lancelot was issued forth of the hold sword in h all armed, angry as a lion. </s>
<s>  the four knights were upon their horses all armed, but no mind had they come a-nigh him, for sore dreaded they the huge buffets he dealt, and his hardiment. </s>
<s>  one of them came forward before the others, and it seemed him shame that they might not vanquish one single knight. </s>
<s>  he goeth to smite lancelot a great stroke of his sword above in the midst of his head, nor did lancelot's sword fail of its stroke, for before he could draw back, lancelot dealt him such a blow as smote oft all of his leg at the thigh, so that he made him leave the saddlebows empty. </s>
<s>  lancelot leapt up on the destrier, and now seemed him he was safer than before. </s>
<s>  the three robber-knights that yet remained whole ran upon him on all sides and began to press him of their swords in right sore wrath. </s>
<s>  thereupon behold you, the knight cometh to the way that goeth to the hold and saith to messire gawain and perceval, "now may you hear the dashing of swords and the melly. </s>
<s> " therewithal the two good knights smite horse with spur and come thither where the three robber-knights were assailing lancelot. </s>
<s>  each of the twain smiteth his own so wrathfully that they thrust their spears right through their bodies and bear them to the ground dead. </s>
<s>  howbeit the third knight was fain to flee, but the knight that had come to show messire gawain the way took heart and hardiment from the confidence of the good knights, and smote him as he fled so sore that he pierced him with his spear to the heart and toppled him to the ground dead. </s>
<s>  and the one whose leg lancelot had lopped off was so trampled underfoot of the knights that he had no life in him. </s>
<s>  vi. </s>
<s>  when lancelot knew perceval and messire gawain he made great joy of them and they of him. </s>
<s>  "lancelot," saith messire gawain, "this knight that led us hither to save your life is cousin to the poor knight of the waste castle, the brother of the two poor damsels that lodged us so well. </s>
<s>  we will send him these horses, one for the knight that shall be the messenger, and the two to the lord of the waste castle, and this hold that we have taken shall be for the two damsels, and so shall we make them safe all the days of their life. </s>
<s>  this, methinketh, will be well. </s>
<s> " "certes," saith perceval, "you speak of great courtesy. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith lancelot, "messire gawain hath said, and right willingly will i grant him all his wish. </s>
<s> " "lords," saith the knight, "they have in this forest a hold wherein the knights did bestow their plunder, for the sake whereof they murdered the passers by. </s>
<s>  if the goods remain there they will be lost, for therein is so great store as might be of much worth to many folk that are poverty-stricken for want thereof. </s>
<s> " they go to the hold and find right great treasure in a cave underground, and rich sets of vessels and rich ornaments of cloth and armours for horses, that they had thrown the one over another into a pit that was right broad. </s>
<s>  "certes," saith he, "right well hath it been done to this evil folk that is destroyed!" "sir," saith lancelot, "in like manner would they have dealt with me and killed me if they might. </s>
<s>  whereof no sorrow have i save of the damsel that i slew, that was one of the fairest dames of the world. </s>
<s>  but i slew her not knowingly, for i meant rather to strike the knight, but she leapt between us, like the hardiest dame that saw i ever. </s>
<s> " "sirs," saith the knight, "perceval and lancelot, by the counsel of messire gawain, granted the treasure to the two damsels, sisters to the poor knight of the waste castle, whereupon let them send for joseus the hermit and bid him guard the treasure until they shall come hither. </s>
<s> " and joseus said that he would do so, and is right glad that the robbers of the forest are made away withal, that had so often made assault upon him. </s>
<s>  he guarded the treasure and the hold right safely in the forest. </s>
<s>  but the dread and the renown of the good knights that had freed the forest went far and wide. </s>
<s>  the knight that led the three destriers was right joyfully received at the waste castle. </s>
<s>  and when he told the message wherewith he was charged by messire gawain, the poor knight and two damsels made great joy thereof. </s>
<s>  perceval taketh leave of messire gawain and lancelot, and saith that never will he rest again until he shall have found his sister and his widow mother. </s>
<s>  they durst not gainsay him, for they know well that he is right, and he prayeth them right sweetly that they salute the king and queen and all the good knights of the court, for, please god, he will go see them at an early day. </s>
<s>  but first he was fain to fulfil the promise king arthur made to his sister, for he would not that the king should be blamed in any place as concerning him, nor by his default. </s>
<s>  and he himself would have the greater blame therein and he succoured her not, for the matter touched him nearer than it did king arthur. </s>
<s>  vii. </s>
<s>  with that the good knight departeth, and they commend him to god, and he them in like sort. </s>
<s>  messire gawain and lancelot go their way back toward the court of king arthur, and perceval goeth amidst strange forests until he cometh to a forest far away, wherein, so it seemed him, he had never been before. </s>
<s>  and he passed through a land that seemed him to have been laid waste, for it was all void of folk. </s>
<s>  wild beast only seeth he there, that ran through the open country. </s>
<s>  he entered into a forest in this waste country, and found a hermitage in the combe of a mountain. </s>
<s>  he alighted without and heard that the hermit was singing the service of the dead, and had begun the mass with a requiem betwixt him and his clerk. </s>
<s>  he looketh and seeth a pall spread upon the ground before the altar as though it were over a corpse. </s>
<s>  he would not enter the chapel armed, wherefore he hearkened to the mass from without right reverently, and showed great devotion as he that loved god much and was a-dread. </s>
<s>  when the mass was sung, and the hermit was disarmed of the armour of our lord, he cometh to perceval and saluteth him and perceval him again. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith perceval, "for whom have you done such service? meseemed that the corpse lay therewithin for whom the service was ordained. </s>
<s> " "you say truth," saith the hermit. </s>
<s>  "i have done it for lohot, king arthur's son, that lieth buried under this pall. </s>
<s> " "who, then, hath slain him?" saith perceval. </s>
<s>  "that will i tell you plainly," saith the hermit. </s>
<s>  viii. </s>
<s>  "this wasted land about this forest wherethrough you have come is the beginning of the kingdom of logres. </s>
<s>  there wont to be therein a giant so big and horrible and cruel that none durst won within half a league round about, and he destroyed the land and wasted it in such sort as you see. </s>
<s>  lohot was departed from the land and the court of king arthur his father in quest of adventure, and by the will of god arrived at this forest, and fought against logrin, right cruel as he was, and logrin against him. </s>
<s>  as it pleased god, lohot vanquished him. </s>
<s>  but lohot had a marvellous custom: when he had slain a man, he slept upon him. </s>
<s>  a knight of king arthur's court, that is called kay the seneschal, was come peradventure into this forest of logres. </s>
<s>  he heard the giant roar when lohot dealt him the mortal blow. </s>
<s>  thither came he as fist as he might, and found the king's son sleeping upon logrin. </s>
<s>  he drew his sword and therewith cut off lohot's head, and took the head and the body and set them in a coffin of stone. </s>
<s>  after that he hacked his shield to pieces with his sword, that he should not be recognised. </s>
<s>  then came he to the giant that lay dead, and so cut oft his head, that was right huge and hideous, and hung it at his fore saddle-bow. </s>
<s>  then went he to the court of king arthur and presented it to him. </s>
<s>  the king made great joy thereof and all they of the court, and the king made broad his lands right freely for that he believed kay had spoken true. </s>
<s>  i went," saith the hermit, "on the morrow to the piece of land where the giant lay dead, as a damsel came within here to tell me with right great joy. </s>
<s>  i found the corpse of the giant so big that i durst not come a-nigh it. </s>
<s>  the damsel led me to the coffin where the king's son was lying. </s>
<s>  she asked the head of me as her guerdon, and i granted it to her willingly. </s>
<s>  she set it forthwith in a coffer laden with precious stones that was all garnished within of balsams. </s>
<s>  after that, she helped me carry the body into this chapel and enshroud and bury it. </s>
<s>  ix. </s>
<s>  "afterwards the damsel departed, nor have i never heard talk of her since, nor do i make remembrance hereof for that i would king arthur should know it, nor for aught that i say thereof that he should do evil to the knight. </s>
<s>  for right sore sin should i have thereof, but deadly treason and disloyalty hath he wrought. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith perceval, "this is sore pity of the king's son, that he is dead in such manner, for i have heard witness that he ever waxed more and more in great chivalry,  so the king knew thereof, kay the seneschal, that is not well-loved of all folk, would lose the court for ever more, or his life, so he might be taken, and this would be only right and just. </s>
<s> " perceval lay the night in the hermitage, and departed on the morrow when he had heard mass. </s>
<s>  he rideth through the forest as he that right gladly would hear tidings of his mother, nor never before hath he been so desirous thereof as is he now. </s>
<s>  he heard, at right hour of noon, a damsel under a tree that made greater dole than ever heard he damsel make before. </s>
<s>  she held her mule by the reins and was alighted a-foot and set herself on her knees toward the east. </s>
<s>  she stretched her hands up toward heaven and prayed right sweetly the saviour of the world and his sweet mother that they would send her succour betimes, for that the most discounselled damsel of the world was she, and never was alms given to damsel to counsel her so well bestowed as it would be upon her, for that needs must she go to the most perilous place that is in the world, and that, save she might bring some one with her, never would that she had to do be done. </s>
<s>  x. </s>
<s>  perceval drew himself up when he heard the damsel bemoaning thus. </s>
<s>  he was in the shadow of the forest so that she saw him not. </s>
<s>  the damsel cried out all weeping, "ha, king arthur, great sin did you in forgetting to speak of my business to the knight that bare away the shield from your court, by whom would my mother have been succoured, that now must lose her castle presently save god grant counsel herein. </s>
<s>  and so unhappy am i, that i have gone through all the lands of great britain, yet may i hear no tidings of my brother, albeit they say that he is the best knight of the world. </s>
<s>  but what availeth us his knighthood, when we have neither aid nor succour thereof? so much the greater shame ought he to have of himself, if he love his mother, as she, that is the most gentle lady that liveth and the most loyal, hath hope that, and he knew, he would come thither. </s>
<s>  either he is dead or he is in lands so far away that none may hear tidings of him. </s>
<s>  ha, sweet lady, mother of our saviour, aid us when we may have no aid of any other! for if my lady mother loseth her castle, needs must we be forlorn wanderers in strange lands, for so have her brothers been long time. </s>
<s>  he that had the most power and valour lieth in languishment, the good king fisherman that the king of castle mortal warreth on, albeit he also is my uncle, my mother's brother, and would fain reave my uncle, that is his brother, of his castle by his felony. </s>
<s>  of a man so evil my lady mother looketh for neither aid nor succour. </s>
<s>  and the good king pelles hath renounced his kingdom for the love of his saviour, and hath entered into a hermitage. </s>
<s>  he likewise is brother of my mother, and behoveth him make war upon none, for the most worshipful hermit is he of the world. </s>
<s>  and all they on my father's side have died in arms. </s>
<s>  eleven were there of them, and my father was the twelfth. </s>
<s>  had they remained on live, well able would they have been to succour us, but the knight that was first at the graal hath undone us, for through him our uncle fell in languishment, in whom should have been our surest succour. </s>
<s> " xi. </s>
<s>  at this word perceval rode forward, and the damsel heareth him. </s>
<s>  she riseth up, and looketh backward and seeth the knight come, the shield at his neck banded argent and azure, with a red cross. </s>
<s>  she clasped her two hands toward heaven, and saith, "ha, sweet lady that didst bear the saviour of the world, you have not forgotten me, nor never may be discounselled he nor she that calleth upon you with the heart. </s>
<s>  here see i the knight come of whom we shall have aid and succour, and our lord god grant him will to do his pleasure, and lend him courage and strength to protect us!" she goeth to meet him, and holdeth his stirrup and would have kissed his foot, but he avoideth it and crieth to her: "ill do you herein, damsel!" and therewith she melteth in tears of weeping and prayeth him right sweetly. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "of such pity as god had of his most sweet mother on that day he took his death, when he beheld her at the foot of the cross, have pity and mercy of my lady mother and of me. </s>
<s>  for, and your aid fail us, we know not to whom to fly for rescue, for i have been told that you are the best knight of the world. </s>
<s>  and for obtaining of your help went i to king arthur's court. </s>
<s>  wherefore succour us for pity's sake and god's and for nought beside, for, so please you, it is your duty so to do, albeit, had you been my brother that is also such a knight as you, whom i cannot find, i might have called upon you of a greater right. </s>
<s>  sir," saith she, "do you remember you of the brachet you had at the court waiting for you until such time as you should come for the shield, and that went away with you, how he would never make joy nor know any save me alone? by this know i well that if you knew the soreness of our need you would succour us. </s>
<s>  but king arthur, that should have prayed you thereof, forgat it. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith he, "so much hath he done that he hath not failed of his covenant with you, for he sent for me by the two best knights of his court, and. </s>
<s>  so i may speed, so much will i do herein as that god and he shall be well pleased thereof. </s>
<s> " xii. </s>
<s>  the damsel had right great joy of the knight that he should grant her his aid, but she knew not he was her brother, or otherwise she would have doubled her joy. </s>
<s>  perceval knoweth well that she is his sister, but he would not yet discover himself and manifest his pity outwardly. </s>
<s>  he helpeth the damsel to mount again and they rode on together. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the damsel, "needs must i go to-night by myself to the grave-yard perilous. </s>
<s> " "wherefore go you thither?" saith perceval. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "i have made vow thereof, and moreover a holy hermit hath told me that the knight that warreth upon us may not be overcome of no knight, save i bring him not some of the cloth wherewith the altar in the chapel of the grave-yard perilous is covered. </s>
<s>  the cloth is of the most holiest, for our lord god was covered therewith in the holy sepulchre, on the third day when he came back from death to life. </s>
<s>  nor none may enter the holy grave-yard that bringeth another with him, wherefore behoveth me go by myself, and may god save my life this night, for the place is sore perilous, and so ought i greatly to hate him that hath procured me this dolour and travail. </s>
<s>  sir," saith she, "you will go your way toward the castle of camelot: there is the widow lady my mother, that awaiteth the return and the succour of the good knight, and may you remember to succour and aid us when you shall see how sore is our need of succour. </s>
<s>  xiii. </s>
<s>  "damsel," saith perceval, "so god allow me i will aid you to the utmost of my power. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith she, "see, this is my way, that is but little frequented, for i tell you that no knight durst tread therein without great peril and great dread. </s>
<s>  and our lord god have your body in keeping, for mine own this night shall be in sore jeopardy and hazard. </s>
<s> " perceval departeth from the damsel, his sister, and hath right great pity for that she goeth in so perilous place all alone. </s>
<s>  natheless would he nor forbid her, for he knew well that she might not go thither with him nor with other, sith that such was the custom of the grave-yard that twain might not pass the entrance, wherefore needs must one remain without. </s>
<s>  perceval was not willing that his sister should break her vow, for never none of his lineage did at any time disloyalty nor base deed knowingly, nor failed of nought that they had in covenant, save only the king of castle mortal, from whom he had as much evil as he had good of the others. </s>
<s>  xiv. </s>
<s>  the damsel goeth her way all alone and all forlorn toward the grave-yard and the deep of the forest, all dark and shadowy. </s>
<s>  she hath ridden until the sun was set and the night draweth nigh. </s>
<s>  she looketh before her and seeth a cross, high and wide and thick. </s>
<s>  and on this cross was the figure of our lord graven, whereof is she greatly comforted. </s>
<s>  she draweth nigh the cross, and so kisseth and adoreth it, and prayeth the saviour of the world that was nailed on holy rood that he would bring her forth of the burial-ground with honour. </s>
<s>  the cross was at the entrance of the grave-yard, that was right spacious, for, from such time as the land was first peopled of folk, and that knights began to seek adventure by the forest, not a knight had died in the forest, that was full great of breadth and length, but his body was borne thither, nor might never knight there be buried that had not received baptism and had repented him not of his sins at his death. </s>
<s>  xv. </s>
<s>  thereinto entered the damsel all alone, and found great multitude of tombs and coffins. </s>
<s>  nor none need wonder whether she had shuddering and fear, for such place must needs be dreadful to a lonely damsel, there where lay so many knights that had been slain in arms. </s>
<s>  josephus the good clerk witnesseth us that within the grave-yard might no evil spirit meddle, for that saint andrew the apostle had blessed it with his hand. </s>
<s>  but never might no hermit remain within for the evil things that appeared each night all round about, that took the shapes of the knights that were dead in the forest, wherof the bodies lay not in the blessed burial-ground. </s>
<s>  xvi. </s>
<s>  the damsel beholdeth their sepulchres all round about the grave- yard whereinto she was come. </s>
<s>  she seeth them surrounded of knights, all black, and spears had they withal, and came one against another, and made such uproar and alarm as it seemed all the forest resounded thereof. </s>
<s>  the most part held swords all red as of fire, and ran either upon other, and gashed one another's hands and feet and nose and face. </s>
