<s> " "fair nephew," said king hermit, "nought had the devil outwardly besides this castle. </s>
<s>  it was the entrance to his fortress, nor would they within ever have been converted save you had been there. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith he, "right sorrowful am i of messire gawain and lancelot, for well i loved their fellowship, and great aid would they have been in my need. </s>
<s> " "fair nephew, had they been chaste as are you, well might they have entered on account of their good knighthood. </s>
<s>  for were they not wanton, the two best knights in the world are they. </s>
<s>  xix. </s>
<s>  "fair nephew, in the time of your knighthood have you much advanced the law of the saviour, for you have destroyed the falsest believe in the world, and this was of them that believed on the bull of copper and the devil that was therein. </s>
<s>  if this folk had remained, and had failed of you, never would it have been destroyed until the end of the world. </s>
<s>  wherefore marvel not that you have travail in serving god, but endure it willingly, for never had worshipful man honour without pains. </s>
<s>  but now behoveth you achieve another matter. </s>
<s>  all they of the land of king fisherman your uncle have abandoned the new law, and returned to that which god hath forbidden. </s>
<s>  but the most part do so rather perforce and for fear of the king that hath seized the l who is my brother and your uncle, than on account of aught else. </s>
<s>  wherefore behoveth you set counsel therein, for this thing may not be achieved by any earthly man save by you only. </s>
<s>  for the castle and land should be yours of right, and sore mischief is it when one that cometh of lineage so high and so holy is traitor to god, and disloyal to the world. </s>
<s>  xx. </s>
<s>  "fair nephew," saith the good man, "the castle hath been much strengthened, for there are now nine bridges newly made, and at each bridge are there three knights tall and strong and hardy, whereof hath he much defence, and your uncle is there within that keepeth the castle. </s>
<s>  but never sithence, none of the knights of king fisherman nor of his priests have there appeared, nor knoweth any what hath befallen them. </s>
<s>  the chapel wherein the most holy graal appeared is all emptied of its sacred hallows. </s>
<s>  the hermits that are by the forest are fain of your coming, for never see they there a knight pass by that believeth in god. </s>
<s>  and so you shall have achieved this enterprise, it is a thing whereof shall god be well pleased. </s>
<s> " xxi. </s>
<s>  "fair uncle," saith perceval, "thither will i go, sith that you commend it to me, for no reason is it that he should have the castle that hath entered thereinto. </s>
<s>  of better right ought my mother to have it, that was the next-born to king fisherman, of whose death am i right sorrowful. </s>
<s> " "fair nephew, you are right! for on your account fell he into languishment,  had you then gone again, so say many, then would he have been whole, but how this might have been i know not of a certainty. </s>
<s>  but methinketh our lord god willed his languishment and death, for had it been his will, you would have made the dem but he willed otherwise, wherefore ought we to give thanks and praise him whatsoever he doth, for he hath foreseen of every man that which shall come to him. </s>
<s>  i have within here a white mule that is very old. </s>
<s>  fair nephew, you will take her with you. </s>
<s>  she will follow you right willingly, and a banner shall you bear, for the power of god and his virtue shall avail more than your own. </s>
<s>  seven-and-twenty knights guard the nine bridges, all chosen and of approved great valour, and none ought now to believe that a single knight may vanquish so many, save the miracle of our lord and his virtue shall open a way for him. </s>
<s>  so i pray and beseech you that you have god always in remembrance and his sweet mother,  so at any time you be put to the worse of your knighthood, mount upon the mule and take the banner, and your enemies shall forthwith lose their force, for nought confoundeth any enemy so swiftly as doth the virtue and puissance of god. </s>
<s>  it is a thing well known that you are the best knight of the world, but set not affiance in your strength nor in your knighthood as against so many knights, for against them may you not endure. </s>
<s> " xxii. </s>
<s>  perceval hearkeneth unto his uncle's discourse and his chastening, and layeth fast hold on all that he saith, wherewith is he pleased full well, for great affiance hath he in his words. </s>
<s>  "fair nephew," saith the hermit, "two lions are there at the entry of the gateway, whereof the one is red and the other white. </s>
<s>  put your trust in the white, for he is on god's side, and look at him whensoever your force shall fail you, and he will look at you likewise in such sort as that straightway you shall know his intent, by the will and pleasure of our saviour. </s>
<s>  wherefore do according as you shall see that he would, for no intent will he have save good only, and to help you. </s>
<s>  nor may you not otherwise succeed in winning past the nine bridges that are warded of the twenty-seven knights. </s>
<s>  and god grant you may win past in such wise that you may save your body and set forward withal the law of our lord that your uncle hath hindered all that he might. </s>
<s> " xxiii. </s>
<s>  perceval departeth from the hermitage, and carrieth away the banner, according to his uncle's counsel, and the white mule followeth after. </s>
<s>  he goeth his way toward the land that was the land of king fisherman, and findeth a hermit that was issued forth of his hermitage and was going at a great pace through the forest. </s>
<s>  he abideth so soon as he beholdeth the cross on perceval's shield. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith he, "i well perceive that you are a christian, of whom not a single one have i seen this long time past. </s>
<s>  for the king of castle mortal is driving us forth of this forest, for he hath renounced god and his sweet mother, so that we durst not remain in his defence. </s>
<s> " "by my faith," saith perceval, "but you shall! for god shall lead you forward, and i after. </s>
<s>  are there more hermits in this forest?" saith perceval. </s>
<s>  "yea, sir, there be twelve here that are waiting for me at a cross yonder before us, and we are minded to go to the kingdom of logres and put our bodies to penance for god's sake, and to abandon our cells and chapels in this forest for dread of this felon king that hath seized the l for he willeth that none who believeth in god should here abide. </s>
<s> " xxiv. </s>
<s>  perceval is come with the hermit to the cross where the good men had assembled them together, and findeth joseus, the young man that was king pelles' son, of whom he maketh right great joy, and he maketh the hermits turn back again with him, saying that he will defend them and make them sate, by god's help, in the kingdom, and prayeth them right sweetly that they make prayer for him to our lord that he grant him to win back that which of right is his own. </s>
<s>  he is come forth of the forest and the hermits with him. </s>
<s>  he draweth nigh to the castle of king fisherman, and strong was the defence at the entrance thereof. </s>
<s>  some of the knights well knew that perceval would conquer him, for long since had it been prophesied that he who bare such shield should win the graal of him that sold god for money. </s>
<s>  xxv. </s>
<s>  the knights saw perceval coming and the company of hermits with him right seemly to behold, and much marvel had they thereof. </s>
<s>  about a couple of bowshots above the bridge was a chapel fashioned like the one at camelot, wherein was a sepulchre, and none knew who lay therein. </s>
<s>  perceval abideth thereby and his company. </s>
<s>  he leaneth his shield and spear against the chapel, and maketh fast his horse and mule by the reins. </s>
<s>  he beholdeth the sepulchre, that was fight fair, and forthwith the sepulchre openeth and the joinings fall apart and the stone lifteth up in such wise that a man might see the knight that lay within, of whom came forth a smell of so sweet savour that it seemed to the good men that were looking on that it had been all embalmed. </s>
<s>  they found a letter which testified that this knight was named josephus. </s>
<s>  so soon as the hermits beheld the sepulchre open, they said to perceval: "sir, now at last know we well that you are the good knight, the chaste, the holy. </s>
<s> " the knights that warded the bridge heard the tidings that the sepulchre had opened at the coming of the knight, whereof were they in the greater dismay, and well understood that it was he that was first at the graal. </s>
<s>  the tidings came to the king that held the castle, and he bade his knights not be dismayed for dread of a single knight, for that he would have no force nor power against them, nor might it never befall but that one only of his own knights should be enough to conquer him. </s>
<s>  xxvi. </s>
<s>  perceval was armed upon his horse. </s>
<s>  the hermits make the sign of the cross over him, and bless him and commend him to god. </s>
<s>  and he holdeth his spear in rest and cometh toward the three knights that guard the first bridge. </s>
<s>  they all set upon him at once and break their spears upon his shield. </s>
<s>  one of them he smiteth with such force that he maketh him topple over into the river that runneth under the bridge, both him and his horse. </s>
<s>  of him was he quit, for the river was wide and deep and swift. </s>
<s>  the others held out against him a much longer bout with sharp sword-play, but he vanquished them and smote them to pieces, and flung their bodies into the water. </s>
<s>  they of the second bridge came forward, that were right good knights, and many a tough bout had he of them and many a felon onslaught. </s>
<s>  joseus that was his uncle's son was there, and said to the other hermits that right fainly would he go help him, but that he deemed it might be sin, and they bade him take no heed of that, for that great work of mercy would it be to destroy the enemies of our lord. </s>
<s>  he doeth off his grey cape and fettleth him in his frock, and taketh one of them that were doing battle with perceval and trusseth him on his neck and so flingeth him into the river all armed, and perceval slayeth the other twain and hurleth them into the river in like manner as the other. </s>
<s>  xxvii. </s>
<s>  by the time he had won the two bridges he was full spent and weary, wherefore he bethinketh him of the lion, the manner whereof his uncle had told him. </s>
<s>  then looketh he toward the entrance of the gateway and seeth the white lion, that stood upright on his two hinder feet, for that he was fain to see him. </s>
<s>  perceval looketh him full between the two eyes, and understandeth that the lion is minded by the will of god to do him to wit that the knights of the third bridge are so hardy and of such strength that they may not be overcome of a single knight and our lord god of his holy bounty open not the way, but that he must fain take the mule and carry the banner if he would conquer them. </s>
<s>  perceval understandeth the white lion's intent, and giveth god thanks thereof and draweth him back, and joseus the young man likewise. </s>
<s>  as soon as they look back, they see that the first bridge is already lifted up behind them. </s>
<s>  xxviii. </s>
<s>  perceval cometh to where the white mule was, and she was starred on the forehead with a red cross. </s>
<s>  he mounteth thereupon, and taketh the banner and holdeth his sword drawn. </s>
<s>  so soon as the white lion seeth him coming, he unchaineth himself and runneth incontinent to the bridge that was lifted, right amidst the knights, and lowereth it forthwith. </s>
<s>  the king of castle mortal was on the battlements of the greater fortress of the castle, and crieth to the knights that warded the bridge, "lords," saith he, "you are the most chosen knights of my land and the hardiest, but no hardiment is it to lift the bridges on account of a single knight whom you durst not abide body to body, whereof meseemeth it great cowardize and not hardiment. </s>
<s>  but the lion is hardier than you all, that of his hardiment hath lowered the bridge. </s>
<s>  wherefore now know i well that had i set him to ward the first bridge, he would have warded it better than these that have allowed themselves to be slain. </s>
<s> " xxix. </s>
<s>  thereupon, behold you perceval come upon his white mule, sword drawn all naked in his fist, and cometh toward them of the third bridge, whereof he smiteth the first so sore that he overthroweth him into the water. </s>
<s>  joseus the hermit cometh forward and would fain have seized the other twain, but they cry mercy of perceval, and say that they will be at his will in all things, and so will believe on god and his sweet mother and abandon their evil lord. </s>
<s>  and they of the fourth bridge say likewise. </s>
<s>  on such condition he alloweth them to live by the counsel of joseus, and they cast away their arms and yield up the bridges at his will. </s>
<s>  perceval thinketh within himself that god's virtue hath right great power, but that knight who hath force and power ought well to approve his prowess for god's sake. </s>
<s>  for of all that he shall do or suffer for him, shall god be well pleased. </s>
<s>  for, were all the world against our lord god, and he should grant to any single one that should be his champion all his power and might, he would conquer them all in one hour of the day. </s>
<s>  but he willeth that a man should travail for him, even as he himself suffered travail for his people. </s>
<s>  xxx. </s>
<s>  perceval cometh again back and alighteth of the white mule and delivereth the banner to joseus, and then mounteth again on his destrier and cometh back to them of the fifth bridge, and these defend themselves right stoutly, for that hardy knights are they, and do battle against perceval full sturdily. </s>
<s>  joseus the hermit cometh thither and assaulteth them with passing great lustihood, that had the lord god not saved him they would have overthrown and slain him. </s>
<s>  howbeit, he holdeth the banner and grappleth them when he may lay hold, and grippeth them so straight that they may not help themselves. </s>
<s>  perceval slayeth them and crusheth them and maketh them topple over into the water that ran swiftly beneath the bridge. </s>
<s>  when they of the sixth bridge saw that these were conquered, they cried mercy of perceval and yielded themselves to him and delivered up their swords to him, and they of the seventh bridge likewise. </s>
<s>  when the red lion saw that the seventh bridge was won, and that the knights of the two bridges had yielded themselves up to perceval, he leapt up with such fury that he burst his chain as had he been wood mad. </s>
<s>  he came to one of the knights and bit him and slew him, whereof the white lion was full wroth, and runneth upon the other lion and teareth him to pieces with his claws and teeth. </s>
<s>  xxxi. </s>
<s>  straightway thereafter he raiseth himself up on his two hinder feet and looketh at perceval, and perceval at him. </s>
<s>  perceval understandeth well the lion's intent, to wit, that they of the last bridge are worse to conquer than the others, and that they may not be conquered at all save by the will of god and by him that is the lion. </s>
<s>  and the lion warned him that he go not against them with the banner, holy though it were, nor receive them into mercy what surety soever they might make, for that they are traitors, but that he must fain mount upon the white mule, for that she is a beast on god's side, and that joseus should bring the banner and all the hermits go before, that are worshipful men and of good life, so as to dismay the traitor king, and so shall the end and the conquest of the castle be brought nigh. </s>
<s>  of all this the lion made signs to perceval, for speak he could not. </s>
<s>  great affiance hath perceval in the lion's warning. </s>
<s>  he alighteth of his destrier and remounteth on the mule, and joseus holdeth the banner. </s>
<s>  the company of twelve hermits was there, right seemly and holy. </s>
<s>  they draw nigh the castle. </s>
<s>  the knights on the last bridge see perceval coming towards them and joseus the hermit holding the banner, by whom they had seen their other fellows wrestled withal and put to the worse. </s>
<s>  xxxii. </s>
<s>  the virtue of our lord and the dignity of the banner and the goodness of the white mule and the holiness of the good hermits that made their orisons to our lord so struck the knights that they lost all power over themselves, but treason might not go forth of their hearts, wherefore right heavy were they of their kinsmen that they had seen slain before them. </s>
<s>  they bethought them that and if by mercy they might escape thence, they would never end until they had slain perceval. </s>
<s>  they come to meet him and so cry him mercy passing sweetly in semblance, and say that they will do his will for ever and ever, so only he will let them depart safe and sound. </s>
<s>  perceval looketh at the lion to know what he shall do. </s>
<s>  he seeth that the lion thinketh them traitors and disloyal, and that so they were destroyed and dead the king that was in the castle would have lost his force. </s>
<s>  and that, so perceval will run upon them, the lion will help him slay them. </s>
<s>  perceval telleth the knights that never will he have mercy upon them, and forthwith runneth upon them, sword drawn, and sorely it misliked him that they defended not themselves, insomuch that he all but left to slay them for that no defence found he in them. </s>
<s>  but the lion is so far from holding them in the like disdain, that he runneth upon them and biteth and slayeth them, and then casteth forth their limbs and bodies into the water. </s>
<s>  perceval alloweth that this is well and seemly, and pleaseth him much of that he seeth the lion do, nor never before had he seen any beast that he might love and prize so highly as this one. </s>
<s>  xxxiii. </s>
<s>  the king of castle mortal was on the battlements of the wall, and seeth how his knights are dead, and how the lion helpeth to slay the last. </s>
<s>  he setteth himself on the highest place of the walls, then lifteth the skirt of his habergeon and holdeth his sword all naked, that was right keen and well-tempered, and so smiteth himself right through the body, and falleth all adown the walls into the water, that was swift and deep, in such sort that perceval saw him, and all the good hermits likewise, that marvelled much of a king that should slay himself in such manner. </s>
<s>  but they say according to the judgment of the scripture, that by right of evil man should the end be evil. </s>
<s>  on such wise was the end of this king of whom i tell you. </s>
<s>  josephus relateth us how none ought to marvel that of three brothers, even though they be sons of the same father and mother, one brother should be evil. </s>
<s>  and the real marvel, saith he, is when one evil corrupteth not the two that are good, for that wickedness is so hard and keen and beguiling, and goodness so kindly and simple and humble. </s>
<s>  cain and abel were brothers-german, yet cain slew his brother abel, the one flesh betrayed the other. </s>
<s>  but great sorrow is it, saith josephus, when the flesh that ought to be one becometh twain, and the one flesh goeth about by wickedness to deceive and destroy the other. </s>
<s>  josephus recordeth us by this evil king that was so traitorous and false and yet was of the lineage of the good soldier joseph of abarimacie. </s>
<s>  this joseph, as the scripture witnesseth, was his uncle, and this evil king was brother-german of king fisherman, and brother of the good king pelles that had abandoned his l in order that he might serve god, and brother of the widow lady that was perceval's mother, the most loyal that was ever in great britain. </s>
<s>  all these lineages were in the service of our lord from the beginning of their lives unto the end, save only this evil king that perished so evilly as you have heard. </s>
<s>  xxxiv. </s>
<s>  you have heard how the king that had seized the castle that had been king fisherman's slew himself in such wise, and how his knights were discomfited. </s>
<s>  perceval entered into the castle and the worshipful hermits together with him. </s>
<s>  it seemed them when they were come within into the master hall, that they heard chant in an inner chapel `gloria in excelsis deo', and right sweet praising of our lord. </s>
<s>  they found the hails right rich and seemly and fairly adorned within. </s>
<s>  they found the chapel open where the sacred hallows were wont to be. </s>
<s>  the holy hermits entered therein and made their orisons, and prayed the saviour of the world that he would swiftly restore to them the most holy graal and the sacred hallows that wont to be therewithin whereby they might be comforted. </s>
<s>  xxxv. </s>
<s>  the good men were there within with perceval, that much loved their company. </s>
<s>  josephus witnesseth us that the ancient knights that were of the household of king fisherman, and the priests and damsels, departed so soon as the king that slew himself had seized the castle, for that they would not be at his court, and the lord god preserved them from him and made them go into such a place as that they should be in safety. </s>
<s>  the saviour of the world well knew that the good knight had won the castle by his valour that should have been his own of right, and sent back thither all them that had served king fisherman. </s>
<s>  perceval made right great joy of them when he saw them, and they of him. </s>
<s>  they seemed well to be a folk that had come from some place where god and his commandments were honoured, and so indeed had they. </s>
<s>  xxxvi. </s>
<s>  the high history witnesseth us that when the conquest of the castle was over, the saviour of the world was right joyous and well pleased thereof. </s>
<s>  the graal presented itself again in the chapel, and the lance whereof the point bleedeth, and the sword wherewith st john was beheaded that messire gawain won, and the other holy relics whereof was right great plenty. </s>
<s>  for our lord god loved the place much. </s>
<s>  the hermits went back to their hermitages in the forest and served our lord as they had been wont. </s>
<s>  joseus remained with perceval at the castle as long as it pleased him, but the good knight searched out the land there where the new law had been abandoned and its maintenance neglected. </s>
<s>  he reft the lives of them that would not maintain it and believe. </s>
<s>  the country was supported by him and made safe, and the law of our lord exalted by his strength and valour. </s>
<s>  the priests and knights that repaired to the castle loved perceval much, for, so far from his goodness minishing in ought, they saw from day to day how his valour and his faith in god increased and multiplied. </s>
<s>  and he showed them the sepulchre of his uncle king fisherman in the chapel before the altar. </s>
<s>  the coffin was rich and the tabernacle costly and loaded of precious stones. </s>
<s>  and the priests and knights bear witness that as soon as the body was placed in the coffin and they were departed thence, they found on their return that it was covered by the tabernacle all dight as richly as it is now to be seen, nor might they know who had set it there save only the commandment of our lord. </s>
<s>  and they say that every night was there a great brightness of light as of candles there, and they knew not whence it should come save of god. </s>
<s>  perceval had won the castle by the command of god. </s>
<s>  the graal was restored in the holy chapel, and the other hallows as you have heard. </s>
<s>  the evil believe was done away from the kingdom, and all were assured again in the new law by the valour of the good knight. </s>
<s>  branch xix. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  now is the story silent of perceval and cometh back to king arthur, the very matter thereof, like as testifieth the history, that in no place is corrupted and the latin lie not. </s>
<s>  king arthur was at cardoil on one day of whitsuntide that was right fair and clear, and many knights were in the hall. </s>
<s>  the king sate at meat and all the knights about him. </s>
<s>  the king looketh at the windows of the hall to right and left, and seeth that two sunbeams are shining within that fill the whole hall with light. </s>
<s>  thereof he marvelleth much and sendeth without the hall to see what it might be. </s>
<s>  the messenger cometh back again and saith thereof that two suns appear to be shining, the one in the east and the other in the west. </s>
<s>  he marvelleth much thereat, and prayeth our lord that he may be permitted to know wherefore two suns should appear in such wise. </s>
<s>  a voice appeared at one of the windows that said to him: "king, marvel not hereof that two suns should appear in the sky, for our lord god hath well the power, and know well that this is for joy of the conquest that the good knight hath made that took away the shield from herewithin. </s>
<s>  he hath won the land that belonged to good king fisherman from the evil king of castle mortal, that did away thence the good believe, and therefore was it that the graal was hidden. </s>
<s>  now god so willeth that you go thither, i and that you choose out the best knights of your court, for better pilgrimage may you never make, and what time you shall return hither, your faith shall be doubled and the people of great britain shall be better disposed and better taught to maintain the service of the saviour. </s>
<s> " ii. </s>
<s>  thereupon the voice departed and well pleased was the king of that it had said. </s>
<s>  he sitteth at meat beside the queen. </s>
<s>  straightway behold you, a damsel that cometh of such beauty as never was greater, and clad right richly, and she beareth a coffer richer than ever you saw, for it was all of fine gold and set with precious stones that sparkled like fire. </s>
<s>  the coffer is not large. </s>
<s>  the damsel holdeth it between her hands. </s>
<s>  when she was alighted she cometh before the king and saluteth him the fairest she may and the queen likewise. </s>
<s>  the king returneth her salute. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "i am come to your court for that it is the sovran of all other, and so bring i you here this rich vessel that you see as a gift. </s>
<s>  and it hath within the head of a knight, but none may open the coffer save he alone that slew the knight. </s>
<s>  wherefore i pray and beseech you, as you are the best king that liveth, that you first set your hand thereon, and in like manner afterwards make proof of your knights, and so the crime and the blood-wite thereof be brought home to you or to any knight that may be within yonder. </s>
<s>  i pray you that the knight who shall be able to open the coffer wherein the head of the knight lieth, and who therefore is he that slew him, shall have grace of forty days after that you shall be returned from the graal. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith the king, "how shall it be known who the knight was?" "sir," saith she, "right eath, for the letters are sealed within that tell his name and the name of him that slew him. </s>
<s> " the king granteth the damsel her will in such wise as she had asked of him. </s>
<s>  he hath received the coffer, then maketh her be set at meat and right richly honoured. </s>
<s>  iii. </s>
<s>  when the king had eaten, the damsel cometh before him. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "make your knights be summoned and ready for that which you have granted me, and you yourself first of all. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith the king, "right willingly. </s>
<s> " he setteth his hand to the coffer, thinking to open it, but it was not right that it should open for him. </s>
<s>  as he set his hand thereon the coffer sweated through just as had it been sprinkled all over and was wet with water. </s>
<s>  the king marvelled greatly, and so made messire gawain set his hand to it and lancelot and all those of the court, but he that might open it was not among them. </s>
<s>  messire kay the seneschal had served at meat. </s>
<s>  he heard say that the king and all the others had essayed and proved the coffer but might not open it. </s>
<s>  he is come thither, all uncalled for. </s>
<s>  "now, then, kay," saith the king, "i had forgotten you. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith kay, "you ought not to forget me, for as good knight am i and of as much worth as they that you have called before me, and you ought not to have delayed to send for me. </s>
<s>  you have summoned all the others, and me not a whit, and yet am i as well able, or ought to be, to open the coffer as are they. </s>
<s>  for against as many knights have i defended me as they, and as many have i slain in defending my body as have they. </s>
<s> " "kay," saith the king, "shall you be so merry and you may open the coffer, and if you have slain the knight whose head lieth therein? by my head, i that am king would fain that the coffer should not open for me, for never was no knight so poor as that he should have neither kinsman nor friend, for he is not loved of all the world that is hated by one man. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith kay, "i would that all the heads of all the knights i have slain, save one only, were in the midst of this hall, and that there were letters sealed with them to say that they were slain by me. </s>
<s>  then would you believe what you are not willing to believe for the envious ones that think they are better worth than i, and yet have not served you so well. </s>
<s> " iv. </s>
<s>  "kay," saith the king, "come forward, there is no need of this. </s>
<s> " messire kay the seneschal cometh to the dais before the king, whereon was the coffer, and taketh it right boldly and setteth one of his hands below it and the other above. </s>
<s>  the coffer opened as soon as he clapped hand thereon, and the head within could be seen all openly. </s>
<s>  a passing delicate-savoured smell and right sweet issued therefrom, so that not a knight in the hall but smelt it. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith kay to the king, "now may you know that some prowess and some hardiment have i done in your service, nor might none of your knights that you prize so highly open the coffer this day, nor would you have known this day who is therein for them! but now you know it by me, and therefore of so much ought you to be well pleased with me!" v. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the damsel that had brought the coffer, "let the letters be read that are within, so shall you know who the knight was and of what lineage, and what was the occasion of his death. </s>
<s> " the king sitteth beside the queen, and biddeth call one of his own chaplains. </s>
<s>  then maketh he all the knights in the hall be seated and keep silence, and commandeth the chaplain that he should spell out the letters of gold all openly according as he should find them written. </s>
<s>  the chaplain looketh at them, and when he had scanned them down, began to sigh. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith he to the king and queen, "hearken unto me, and all the other, your knights. </s>
<s>  vi. </s>
<s>  "these letters say that the knight whose head lieth in this vessel was named lohot and he was son of king arthur and queen guenievre. </s>
<s>  he had slain on a day that is past, logrin the giant, by his hardiment. </s>
<s>  messire kay the seneschal was passing by there, and so found lohot sleeping upon logrin, for such was his custom that he went to sleep upon the man after that he had slain him. </s>
<s>  messire kay smote off lohot's head, and so left the head and the body on the piece of ground. </s>
<s>  he took the head of the giant and so bore it to the court of king arthur. </s>
<s>  he gave the king and queen and all the barons of the court to understand that he had slain him, but this did he not. </s>
<s>  rather, that he did was to slay lohot, according to the writing and the witness of these letters. </s>
<s> " when the queen heareth these letters and this witting of her son that came thus by his death, she falleth in a swoon on the coffer. </s>
<s>  after that she taketh the head between her two hands, and knew well that it was he by a scar that he had on his face when he was a child. </s>
<s>  the king himself maketh dole thereof so sore that none may comfort him, for before these tidings he had thought that his son was still on live and that he was the best knight in the world, and when the news came to his court that the knight of the golden circlet had slain the knight of the dragon, he supposed that it had been lohot his son, for that none had named perceval nor gawain nor lancelot. </s>
<s>  and all they of the court are right sorrowful for the death of lohot, and messire kay hath departed, and if the damsel had nor respited the day until the fortieth after the king's return, vengeance would have been taken of kay or ever he might have turned him thence. </s>
<s>  for never did no i man see greater dole made in the king's court than they of the table round made for the youth. </s>
<s>  king arthur and the queen were so stricken of sorrow that none durst call upon them to make cheer. </s>
<s>  the damsel that brought thither the coffer was well avenged of the shame that messire kay the seneschal had done her on a day that was past, for this thing would not have been known so soon save it had been by her. </s>
<s>  vii. </s>
<s>  when the mourning for the king's son was abated, lancelot and many others said unto him, "sir, you know well that god willeth you should go to the castle that was king fisherman's on pilgrimage to the most holy graal, for it is not right to delay a thing that one hath in covenant with god. </s>
<s> " "lords," saith the king, "right willingly will i go, and thereto am i right well disposed. </s>
<s> " the king apparelleth himself for the pilgrimage, and saith that messire gawain and lancelot shall go with him, without more knights, and taketh a squire to wait upon his body, and the queen herself would he have taken thither but for the mourning she made for her son, whereof none might give her any comfort. </s>
<s>  but or ever the king departed he made the head be brought into the isle of avalon, to a chapel of our lady that was there, where was a worshipful holy hermit that was well loved of our lord. </s>
<s>  the king departed from cardoil and took leave of the queen and all the knights. </s>
<s>  lancelot and messire gawain go along with him and a squire that carrieth their arms. </s>
<s>  kay the seneschal was departed from the court for dread of the king and his knights. </s>
<s>  he durst not abide in the greater britain, and so betook himself into the lesser. </s>
<s>  briant of the isles was of great power in those times, a knight of great strength and hardiment, for all great britain had had many disputes between him and king arthur. </s>
<s>  his land was full strong of castles and forests and right fruitful, and many good knights had he in his land. </s>
<s>  when he knew that kay the seneschal had departed in such sort from the court, and that he had crossed the sea, he sent for him and held him of his household, and said that he would hold him harmless against the king and against all men. </s>
<s>  when he knew that the king had departed he began to war upon the land and to slay his men and to challenge his castles. </s>
<s>  branch xx. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  the story saith that king arthur goeth his way and lancelot and messire gawain with him, and they had ridden so far one day that night came on in a forest and they might find no hold. </s>
<s>  messire gawain marvelled him much that they had ridden the day long without finding neither hold nor hermitage. </s>
<s>  night was come and the sky was dark and the forest full of gloom. </s>
<s>  they knew not whitherward to turn to pass the night. </s>
<s>  "lords," saith the king, "where may we be able to alight to- night?" "sir, we know not, for this forest is fight wearisome. </s>
<s> " they make the squire climb up a tall tree and tell him to look as far as he may to try whether he may espy any hold or house where they may lodge. </s>
<s>  the squire looketh on all sides, and then telleth them he seeth a fire a long way off as if it were in a waste house, but that he seeth nought there save the fire and the house. </s>
<s>  "take good heed," saith lancelot, "in which quarter it is, so that you may know well how to lead us thither. </s>
<s> " he saith that right eath may he lead them. </s>
<s>  ii. </s>
<s>  with that he cometh down and mounteth again on his hackney, and they go forward a great pace and ride until they espy the fire and the hold. </s>
<s>  they pass on over a bridge of wattles, and find the courtyard all deserted and the house from within great and high and hideous. </s>
<s>  but there was a great fire within whereof the heat might be felt from afar. </s>
<s>  they alight of their horses, and the squire draweth them on one side amidst the hall, and the knights set them beside the fire all armed. </s>
<s>  the squire seeth a chamber in the house and entereth thereinto to see if he may find any meat for the horses, but he cometh forth again the swiftest he may and crieth right sweetly on the mother of the saviour. </s>
<s>  they ask him what aileth him, and he saith that he hath found the most treacherous chamber ever he found yet, for he felt there, what with heads and what with hands, more than two hundred men dead, and saith that never yet felt he so sore afeared. </s>
<s>  lancelot went into the chamber to see whether he spake true, and felt the men that lay dead, and groped among them from head to head and felt that there was a great heap of them there, and came back and sate at the fire all laughing. </s>
<s>  the king asketh whether the squire had told truth. </s>
<s>  lancelot answereth him yea, and that never yet had he found so many dead men together. </s>
<s>  "methinketh," saith messire gawain, "sith that they are dead we have nought to fear of them, but god protect us from the living. </s>
<s> " iii. </s>
<s>  while they were talking thus, behold you a damsel that cometh into the dwelling on foot and all alone, and she cometh lamenting right grievously. </s>
<s>  "ha, god!" saith she, "how long a penance is this for me, and when will it come to an end?" she seeth the knights sitting in the midst of the house. </s>
<s>  "fair lord god," saith she, "is he there within through whom i am to escape from this great dolour?" the knights hearken to her with great wonderment. </s>
<s>  they look and see her enter within the door, and her kirtle was all torn with thorns and briars in the forest. </s>
<s>  her feet were all bleeding for that she was unshod. </s>
<s>  she had a face of exceeding great beauty. </s>
<s>  she carried the half of a dead man, and cast it into the chamber with the others. </s>
<s>  she knew lancelot again so soon as she saw him. </s>
<s>  "ha, god !" saith she, "i am quit of my penance! sir," saith she, "welcome may you be, you and your company!" lancelot looketh at her in wonderment. </s>
<s>  "damsel," saith he, "are you a thing on god's behalf?" "certes, sir," saith she, "yea! nor be you adread of nought! i am the damsel of the castle of beards, that was wont to deal with knights so passing foully as you have seen. </s>
<s>  you did away the toll that was levied on the knights that passed by, and you lay in the castle that demanded it of them that passed through the demesne thereof. </s>
<s>  but you had me in covenant that so the holy graal should appear unto you, you would come back to me, for otherwise never should i have been willing to let you go. </s>
<s>  you returned not, for that you saw not the graal. </s>
<s>  for the shame that i did to knights was this penance laid upon me in this forest and this manor, to last until such time as you should come. </s>
<s>  for the cruelty i did them was sore grievous, for never was knight brought to me but i made his nose be cut off or his eyes thrust out, and some were there as you saw that had their feet or their hands stricken off. </s>
<s>  now have i paid full dear thereof since, for needs must i carry into this chamber all the knights that are slain in this forest, and within this manor must i cast them according to the custom thereof, alone, without company. </s>
<s>  and this knight that i carried in but now hath lain so long in the forest that wild beasts have eaten half of his body. </s>
<s>  now am i quit of this foul penance, thanks to god and to you, save only that i must go back when it shall be daylight in like manner as i came here. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith lancelot, "right glad am i that we should have come to lodge the night here within, for love of you, for i never saw i damsel that might do so cruel penance. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith she, "you know not yet what it is, but you will know it ere long this night, both you and your fellows, and the lord god shield you from death and from mischief! every night cometh a rout of knights that are black and foul and hideous, albeit none knoweth whence they come, and they do battle right sore the one against other, and the stour endureth of a right long while. </s>
<s>  but one knight that came within yonder by chance, the first night i came hither, in like manner as you have come, made a circle round me with his sword, and i sate within it as soon as i saw them coming, and so had i no dread of them, for i had in remembrance the saviour of the world and his passing sweet mother. </s>
<s>  and you will do the same, and you believe me herein, for these are knights fiends. </s>
<s> " lancelot draweth his sword and maketh a great circle round the house-place, and they were within. </s>
<s>  v. </s>
<s>  thereupon, behold you the knights that come through the forest with such a rushing as it seemed they would rend it all up by the roots. </s>
<s>  afterward, they enter into the manor and snatch great blazing firebrands and fling them one at another. </s>
<s>  they enter into the house battling together, and are keen to fall upon the knights, but they may not. </s>
<s>  they hurl the firebrands at them from afar, but they are holding their shields and their swords naked. </s>
<s>  lancelot maketh semblant as though he would leap towards them, and sore great cowardize it seemeth him nor to go against them. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith the damsel, "take heed that you go not forth of the circle, for you will be in sore jeopardy of death, for well you see what evil folk be these. </s>
<s> " lancelot was nor minded to hold himself back, but that he would go toward them sword drawn, and they run upon him on all sides, but he defendeth him stoutly and smiteth the burning firebrands so that he maketh red-hot charcoal fly, and thrusreth his sword amidst their faces. </s>
<s>  king arthur and messire gawain leap up to help lancelot and smite upon these evil folk and cut them limb from limb, and they bellow like fiends so that the whole forest resoundeth thereof. </s>
<s>  and when they fell to the ground, they may no longer endure, but become fiends and ashes, and their bodies and their horses become devils all black in the shape of ravens that come forth of their bodies. </s>
<s>  they marvel right sore what this may be, and say that such hostel is right grievous. </s>
<s>  vi. </s>
<s>  when they had put them all to the worse, they sate them down again and rested. </s>
<s>  but scarce were they seated or ever another rout of yet blacker folk came about them, and they bare spears burning and flaming, and many of them carried dead knights that they had slain in the forest, and dropped them in the midst of the house, and then bid the damsel carry and set them with the others. </s>
<s>  howbeit, she answereth that she is quit of their commandment and service, nor no longer is forced to do nought for them sith that she hath done her penance. </s>
<s>  they thrust forward their spears toward the king and the two knights, as though they were come to avenge their companions. </s>
<s>  but they all three leapt up together and attacked them right stoutly. </s>
<s>  but this rout was greater and of knights more hideous. </s>
<s>  they began to press the king and his knights hard, and they might not put them to the worse as they did the others. </s>
<s>  and while they were thus in the thickest of the conflict, they heard the stroke of a bell sounding, and forthwith the knight fiends departed and hurried away a great pace. </s>
<s>  "lords," saith the damsel, "had this sound not been heard, scarce might you have endured, for yet another huge rout of this folk was coming in such sort as that none might have withstood them, and this sound have i heard every night, whereby my life hath been saved. </s>
<s> " vii. </s>
<s>  josephus telleth us that as at this time was there no bell neither in greater britain nor in lesser. </s>
<s>  but folk were called together by a horn, and in many places there were sheets of steel, and in other places clappers of wood. </s>
<s>  king arthur marvelled him much of this sound, so clear and sweet was it, and it well seemed him that it came on god's behalf, and right fain was he to see a bell and so he might. </s>
<s>  they were the night until the morrow in the house, as i tell you. </s>
<s>  the damsel took leave of them and so departed. </s>
<s>  as they came forth of the hold, they met three hermits that told them they were going to search for the bodies that were in this manor so that they might bury them in a waste chapel that was hard by, for such knights had lain there as that henceforward the haunting of the evil folk would be stayed in such sort as that they would have no more power to do hurt to any, wherefore they would set therewithin a worshipful hermit that should build up the place in holiness for the service of god. </s>
<s>  the king was right joyful thereof, and told them that it had been too perilous. </s>
<s>  they parted from the hermits and entered into a forest, nor was there never a day so long as king arthur was on pilgrimage, so saith the history, but he heard the sound of one single bell every hour, whereof he was right glad. </s>
<s>  he bade messire gawain and lancelot that they should everywhere conceal his name, and that they should call him not lord but comrade. </s>
<s>  they yielded him his will, and prayed to our lord that he would guide and lead them to such a castle and such a hostel as that they might be lodged honourably therein. </s>
<s>  they rode on until evening drew nigh, and they found a right fair hold in the forest, whereinto they entered and alighted. </s>
<s>  the damsel of the hold came to meet them and made them right great cheer, then made them be disarmed, afterward bringeth them right rich robes to wear. </s>
<s>  she looketh at lancelot and knoweth him again. </s>
<s>  viii. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "you had once, on a day that is past, right great pity of me, and saved me my honour, whereof am i in great unhappiness. </s>
<s>  but better love i to suffer misease in honour, than to have plenty and abundance in shame or reproach, for shame endureth, but sorrow is soon overpassed. </s>
<s> " thereupon behold you the knight of the hold, whither he cometh from shooting in the forest and maketh carry in full great plenty venison of deer and wild boar. </s>
<s>  he alighted to greet the knights, and began to laugh when he saw lancelot. </s>
<s>  "by my head," saith he, "i know you well for you disappointed me of the thing i best loved in the world, and made me marry this damsel that never yet had joy of me, nor never shall have. </s>
<s> " "faith, sir," saith lancelot, "you will do your pleasure therein, for she is yours. </s>
<s>  truth it is that i made you marry her, for you were fain to do her a disgrace and a shame in such sort that her kinsfolk would have had shame of her. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith the knight, "the damsel that i loved before loveth you no better hereof, nay, rather, fain would she procure your vexation and your hurt and your shame if she may, and great power hath she in this forest. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith lancelot, "i have sithence spoken to her and she to me, and so hath she told me her will and her wish. </s>
<s> " thereupon the knight bade the knights take water, and the lady taketh the basins and presenteth water to the knights. </s>
<s>  "avoid, damsel," saith the king, "take it away! never, please god, shall it befall that we should accept such service from you. </s>
<s> " "by my head," saith the knight, "but so must you needs do, for other than she shall not serve you to-night in this matter, or otherwise shall you not eat with me this night there within. </s>
<s> " ix. </s>
<s>  lancelot understandeth that the knight is not overburdened of courtesy, and he seeth the table garnished of good meat, and bethinketh him he will not do well to lose such ease, for misease enough had they the night before. </s>
<s>  he maketh the king take water of the lady, and the same service did she for all of them. </s>
<s>  the knight biddeth them be seated. </s>
<s>  the king would have made the lady sit beside him at the table, but the knight said that there she should not sit. </s>
<s>  she goeth to sit among the squires as she was wont to do. </s>
<s>  the knights are sorry enough thereof, but they durst not gainsay the will of her lord. </s>
<s>  when they had eaten, the knight said to lancelot, "now may you see what she hath gained of me by your making me take her perforce, nor never, so help me god, so long as i live shall she be honoured otherwise by me, for so have i promised her that i love far more. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith lancelot, "to my thinking you do ill herein and a sin, and meseemeth you should have great blame thereof of them that know it, and may your churlishness be your own, for nought thereof take i to myself. </s>
<s> " x. </s>
<s>  lancelot telleth the king and messire gawain that were he not lodged in his hostel, and had him outside of the hold, he would willingly have set the blood of his body on it but he would have handled him in such sort as that the lady should be maintained in greater honour, either by force or by prayer, in like manner as he did when he made him marry her. </s>
<s>  they were right well lodged the night and lay in the hold until the morrow, when they departed thence, and rode right busily on their journeys until they came into a very different l scarce inhabited of any folk, and found a little castle in a combe. </s>
<s>  they came thitherward and saw that the enclosure of the castle was fallen down into an abysm, so that none might approach it on that side, but it had a right fair gateway and a door tall and wide whereby one entered. </s>
<s>  they beheld a chapel that was right fair and rich, and below was a great ancient hall. </s>
<s>  they saw a priest appear in the midst of the castle, bald and old, that had come forth of the chapel. </s>
<s>  they are come thither and alighted, and asked the priest what the castle was, and he told them that it was the great tintagel. </s>
<s>  "and how is this ground all caved in about the castle?" "sir," saith the priest, "i will tell you. </s>
<s>  sir," saith he, "king uther pendragon, that was father of king arthur, held a great court and summoned all his barons. </s>
<s>  the king of this castle that then was here was named gorlois. </s>
<s>  he went to the court and took his wife with him, that was named ygerne, and she was the fairest dame in any kingdom. </s>
<s>  king uther sought acquaintance of her for her great beauty, and regarded her and honoured her more than all the others of his court. </s>
<s>  king gorlois departed thence and made the queen come back to this castle for the dread that he had of king uther pendragon. </s>
<s>  king uther was very wroth with him, and commanded him to send back the queen his wife. </s>
<s>  king godois said that he would not. </s>
<s>  thereupon king uther pendragon defied him, and then laid siege about this castle where the queen was. </s>
<s>  king gorlois was gone to seek for succour. </s>
<s>  king uther pendragon had merlin with him of whom you have heard tell, that was so crafty. </s>
<s>  he made him be changed into the semblance of king gorlois, so that he entered there within by merlin's art and lay that night with the queen, and so begat king arthur in a great hall that was next to the enclosure there where this abysm is. </s>
<s>  and for this sin hath the ground sunken in on this wise. </s>
<s> " he cometh with them toward the chapel that was right fair, and had a right rich sepulchre therein. </s>
<s>  "lords, in this sepulchre was placed the body of merlin, but never mought it be set inside the chapel, wherefore perforce it remained outside. </s>
<s>  and know of a very truth that the body lieth not within the sepulchre, for, so soon as it was set therein, it was taken out and snatched away, either on god's behalf or the enemy's, but which we know not. </s>
<s> " xi. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith king arthur, "and what became of king gorlois?" "sir. </s>
<s> " saith he, "the king slew him on the morrow of the night he lay with his wife, and so forthwith espoused queen ygerne, and in such manner as i tell you was king arthur conceived in sin that is now the best king in the world. </s>
<s> " king arthur hath heard this as concerning his birth that he knew not, and is a little shamed thereof and confounded on account of messire gawain and lancelot. </s>
<s>  he himself marvelleth much thereof, and much it misliketh him that the priest hath said so much. </s>
<s>  they lay the night in the hold, and so departed thence on the morrow when they had heard mass. </s>
<s>  lancelot and messire gawain, that thought they knew the forest, found the land so changed and different that they knew not whither they were become, and such an one as should come into the land that had been king fisherman's, and he should come again another time within forty days, should not find the castle within a year. </s>
<s>  xii. </s>
<s>  josephus telleth us that the semblances of the islands changed themselves by reason of the divers adventures that by the pleasure of god befell therein, and that the quest of adventures would not have pleased the knights so well and they had not found them so different. </s>
<s>  for, when they had entered into a forest or an island where they had found any adventure, and they came there another time, they found holds and castles and adventures of another kind, so that their toils and travails might not weary them, and also for that god would that the land should be conformed to the new law. </s>
<s>  and they were the knights that had more toil and travail in seeking adventures than all the knights of the world before them, and in holding to that whereof they had made covenant. </s>
<s>  nor of no court of no king in the world went forth so many good knights as went forth from the court of king arthur, and but that god loved them so much, never might they have endured such toil and travail as they did from day to day. </s>
<s>  for without fait, good knights were they, and good knights not only to deal hard buffets, but rather in that they were loyal and true, and had faith in the saviour of the world and his sweet mother, and therefore dreaded shame and loved honour. </s>
<s>  king arthur goeth on his way and messire gawain and lancelot with him, and they pass through many strange countries, and so enter into a great forest. </s>
<s>  lancelot called to remembrance the knight that he had slain in the waste city whither behoved him to go, and knew well that the day whereon he should come was drawing nigh. </s>
<s>  he told king arthur as much, and then said, that and he should go not, he would belie his covenant. </s>
<s>  they rode until they came to a cross where the ways forked. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith lancelot, "behoveth me go to acquit me of my pledge, and i go in great adventure and peril of death, nor know i whether i may live at all thereafter, for i slew the knight, albeit i was right sorry thereof, but or ever i slew him, i had to swear that i would go set my head in the like jeopardy as he had set his. </s>
<s>  now the day draweth nigh that i must go thither, for i am unwilling to fail of my covenant, whereof i should be blamed,  so god grant me to escape therefrom, i will follow you speedily. </s>
<s> " the king embraceth him and kisseth him at parting and messire gawain also, and they pray god preserve his body and his life, and that they may see him again ere it be long. </s>
<s>  lancelot would willingly have sent salute to the queen had he durst, for she lay nearer his heart than aught beside, but he would not that the king nor messire gawain should misdeem of the love they might carry to their kinswoman. </s>
<s>  the love is so rooted in his heart that he may not leave it, into what peril soever he may go. </s>
<s>  rather, he prayeth god every day as sweetly as he may, that he save the queen, and that he may deliver his body from this jeopardy. </s>
<s>  he hath ridden until that he cometh at the hour of noon into the waste city, and findeth the city empty as it was the first time he was there. </s>
<s>  xiii. </s>
<s>  in the city wherein lancelot had arrived were many waste houses and rich palaces fallen down. </s>
<s>  he had scarce entered within the city when he heard a great cry and lamentation of dames and damsels, but he knew not on which side it was, and they say: "ha, god, how hath the knight betrayed us that slew the knight, inasmuch as he returneth not! this day is the day come that he ought to redeem his pledge! never again ought any to put trust in knight, for that he cometh not! the others that came hither before him have failed us, and so will he also for dread of death. </s>
<s>  for he smote off the head of the comeliest knight that was in this kingdom and the best, wherefore ought he also to have his own smitten off, but good heed taketh he to save it if he may!" thus spake the damsels. </s>
<s>  lancelot much marvelled where they might be, for nought could he espy of them, albeit he cometh before the palace, there where he slew the knight. </s>
<s>  he alighteth, then maketh fast his horse's reins to a ring that was fixed in the mounting-stage of marble. </s>
<s>  scarce hath he done so, when a knight alighteth, tall and comely and strong and deliver, and he was clad in a short close-fitted jerkin of silk, and held the axe in his hand wherewith lancelot had smitten off the head of the other knight, and he came sharpening it on a whetstone to cut the better. </s>
<s>  lancelot asketh him, "what will you do with this axe?" "by my head," saith the knight, "that shall you know in such sort as my brother knew when you cut off his head, so i may speed of my business. </s>
<s> " "how?" saith lancelot, "will you slay me then?" "that shall you know," saith he, "or ever you depart hence. </s>
<s>  have you not loyally promised hereof that you would set your head in the same jeopardy as the knight set his, whom you slew without defence? and no otherwise may you depart therefrom. </s>
<s>  wherefore now come forward without delay and kneel down and stretch your neck even as my brother did, and so will i smite off your head,  if you do nor this of your own good will, you shall soon find one that shall make you do it perforce, were you twenty knights as good as you are one. </s>
<s>  but well i know that you have not come hither for this, but only to fulfil your pledge, and that you will raise no contention herein. </s>
<s> " lancelot thinketh to die, and is minded to abide by that he hath in covenant without fail, wherefore he lieth down on the ground as it were on a cross, and crieth mercy of god. </s>
<s>  he mindeth him of the queen, and crieth god of mercy and saith, "ha, lady" saith he, "never shall i see you more!  might i have seen you yet once again before i die, exceeding great comfort had it been to me, and my soul would have departed from me more at ease. </s>
<s>  but this, that never shall i see you more, as now it seemeth me, troubleth me more than the death whereby behoveth me to die, for die one must when one hath lived long enough. </s>
<s>  but faithfully do i promise you that my love shall fail you not yet, and never shall it be but that my soul shall love you in the other world like as my body hath loved you in this, if thus the soul may love!" with that the tears fell from his eyes, nor, never sithence that he was knight, saith the story, had he wept for nought that had befallen him nor for heaviness of heart, but this time and one other. </s>
<s>  he taketh three blades of grass and so eateth thereof in token of the holy communion, then signeth him of the cross and blesseth him, riseth up, setteth himself on his knees and stretcheth forth his neck. </s>
<s>  the knight lifteth up the axe. </s>
<s>  lancelot heareth the blow coming, boweth his head and the axe misseth him. </s>
<s>  he saith to him, "sir knight, so did not my brother that you slew. </s>
<s>  rather, he held his head and neck quite still, and so behoveth you to do!" two damsels appeared at the palace-windows of passing great beauty, and they knew lancelot well. </s>
<s>  so, as the knight was aiming a second blow, one of the damsels crieth to him, "and you would have my love for evermore, throw down the axe and cry the knight quit! otherwise have you lost me for ever!" the knight forthwith flingeth down the axe and falleth at lancelot's feet and crieth mercy of him as of the most loyal knight in the world. </s>
<s>  "but you? have mercy on me, you! and slay me not!" saith lancelot, "for it is of you that i ought to pray mercy!" "sir," saith the knight, "of a surety will i not do this! rather will i help you to my power to save your life against all men, for all you have slain my brother. </s>
<s> " the damsels come down from the palace and are come to lancelot. </s>
<s>  xiv. </s>
<s>  "sir," say they to lancelot, "greatly ought we to love you, yea, better than all knights in the world beside. </s>
<s>  for we are the two damsels, sisters, that you saw so poor at the waste castle where you lay in our brother's house. </s>
<s>  you and messire gawain and another knight gave us the treasure and the hold of the robber- knights that you slew. </s>
<s>  for this city which is waste and the waste castle of my brother would never again be peopled of folk, nor should we never have had the land again, save a knight had come hither as loyal as are you. </s>
<s>  full a score knights have arrived here by chance in the same manner as you came, and not one of them but hath slain a brother or a kinsman and cut off his head as you did to the knight, and each one promised to return at the day appointed. </s>
<s>  but all failed of their covenant, for not one of them durst come to the day. </s>
<s>  and so you had failed us in like manner as the others, we should have lost this city without recovery and the castles that are its appanages. </s>
<s> " xv. </s>
<s>  so the knight and the damsels lead lancelot into the palace and then make him be disarmed. </s>
<s>  they hear presently how the greatest joy in the world is being made in many parts of the forest, that was nigh the city. </s>
<s>  "sir," say the damsels, "now may you hear the joy that is made of your coming. </s>
<s>  these are the burgesses and dwellers in the city that already know the tidings. </s>
<s> " lancelot leaneth at the windows of the hall, and seeth the city peopled of the fairest folk in the world, and great thronging in the broad streets and the great palace, and clerks and priests coming in long procession praising god and blessing him for that they may now return to their church, and giving benison to the knight through whom they are free to repair thither. </s>
<s>  lancelot was much honoured throughout the city. </s>
<s>  the two damsels are at great pains to wait upon him, and right great worship had he of all them that were therewithin and them that came thither, both clerks and priests. </s>
<s>  branch xxi. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  therewithal the history is silent of lancelot, and speaketh word of the king and messire gawain, that are in sore misgiving as concerning him, for right gladly would they have heard tidings of him. </s>
<s>  they met a knight that was coming all armed, and messire gawain asketh him whence he came, and he said that he came from the land of the queen of the golden circlet, to whom a sore loss hath befallen. </s>
<s>  for the son of the widow lady had won the circlet of gold for that he had slain the knight of the dragon, and she was to keep it safe for him and deliver it up to him at his will. </s>
<s>  "but now hath nabigant of the rock reft her thereof, and a right outrageous knight is he and puissant. </s>
<s>  wherefore hath he commanded a damsel that she bring it to an assembly of knights that is to be held in the meadow of the tent of the two damsels, there where messire gawain did away the evil custom. </s>
<s>  the damsel that will bring the golden circlet will give it to the knight that shall do best at the assembly. </s>
<s>  nabigant is keenly set upon having it, and maketh the more sure for that once aforetime he hath had it by force of arms. </s>
<s>  and i am going to the knights that know not these tidings, in order that when they shall hear them, they shall go to the assembly. </s>
<s> " therewithal the knight departeth. </s>
<s>  the king and messire gawain have ridden so far that they come to the tent where messire gawain destroyed the evil custom by slaying the two knights. </s>
<s>  he found the tent garnished within and without in like manner as it was when he was there, and messire gawain made the king be seated on a quilted mattress of straw, right costly, and thereafter be disarmed of a squire, and he himself disarmed him, and they washed their hands and faces for the rust wherewith both of them were besmuttered. </s>
<s>  and messire gawain found the chests unlocked that were at the head of the couch, and made the king be apparelled of white rich stuffs that he found, and a robe of cloth of silk and gold, and he clad himself in the like manner, neither was the chest not a whit disfurnished thereby, for the tent was all garnished of rich adornments. </s>
<s>  when they were thus dight, a man might have sought far or ever he should find so comely knights. </s>
<s>  ii. </s>
<s>  thereupon, behold you the two damsels of the tent coming. </s>
<s>  "damsels," saith messire gawain, "welcome may you be. </s>
<s> " "sir," say they, "good adventure may you have both twain. </s>
<s>  it seemeth us that you take right boldly that which is ours, yet never for neither of us would you do a thing whereof you were beseeched. </s>
<s> " "messire gawain" saith the elder, "no knight is there in this kingdom but would be right joyous and he supposed that i loved him, and i prayed you of your love on a day that is past, for the valour of your knighthood, yet never did you grant it me. </s>
<s>  how durst you have affiance in me of aught, and take the things that are mine own so boldly, when i may not have affiance in you?" "damsel, for your courtesy and the good custom of the land. </s>
<s>  for you told me when the evil customs were overthrown, that all the honours and all the courtesies that are due to knights should ever be ready within for all them that should come hither for harbour. </s>
<s> " "messire gawain, you say true, but of right might one let the courtesy tarry and pay back churlishness by churlishness. </s>
<s> " iii. </s>
<s>  "the assembly of knights will begin to-morrow in this launde that is so fair. </s>
<s>  there will be knights in plenty, and the prize will be the circlet of gold. </s>
<s>  now shall we see who will do best. </s>
<s>  the assembly will last three whole days, and of one thing at least you may well make boast between you and your comrade, that you have the fairest hostel and the most pleasant and the most quiet of any knights at the assembly. </s>
<s> " the younger damsel looketh at king arthur. </s>
<s>  "and you," saith she, what will you do? will you be as strange toward us as messire gawain is friendly with others?" iv. </s>
<s>  "damsel," saith the king, "messire gawain will do his pleasure and i mine. </s>
<s>  strange shall i not be in respect of you, nor toward other damsels. </s>
<s>  rather shall they be honoured on my part so long as i live, and i myself will be at your commandment. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith she, "gramercy greatly. </s>
<s>  i pray you, therefore, that you be my knight at the tournament. </s>
<s> " "damsel, this ought i not to refuse you, and right glad at heart shall i be and i may do aught that shall please you. </s>
<s>  for all knights ought to be at pains for the sake of dame or damsel. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith she, "what is your name?" v. </s>
<s>  "damsel," saith he, "my name is arthur, and i am of tincardoil. </s>
<s> " "have you nought to do with king arthur?" "damsel, already have i been many times at his court,  if he loved me not nor i him, i should not be in messire gawain's company. </s>
<s>  in truth, he is the king in the world that i love best. </s>
<s> " the damsel looketh at king arthur, but wotteth not a whir that it is he, and full well is she pleased with the seeming and countenance of him. </s>
<s>  as for the king, lightly might he have trusted that he should have her as his lady-love so long as he remained with her. </s>
<s>  but there is much to say betwixt his semblant and his thought, for he showeth good semblant toward the damsel, that hath over much affiance therein, but his thought is on queen guenievre in what place soever he may be. </s>
<s>  for nought loveth he so well as her. </s>
<s>  vi. </s>
<s>  the damsels made stable the horses and purvey for the bodies of the knights right richly at night, and they lay in two right rich beds in the midst of the hall, and their arms were all set ready before. </s>
<s>  the damsels would not depart until such time as they were asleep. </s>
<s>  the harness of the knights that came to the assembly came on the morrow from all parts. </s>
<s>  they set up their booths and stretched their tents all round about the launde of the forest. </s>
<s>  king arthur and messire gawain were risen in the morning and saw the knights come from all parts. </s>
<s>  the elder damsel cometh to messire gawain and saith unto him, "sir," saith she, "i will that you bear to-day red arms that i will lend you, for the love of me, and take heed that they be well employed, and i desire that you should not be known by your arms. </s>
<s>  rather let it be said that you are the red knight, and you shall allow it accordingly. </s>
<s> " "damsel, gramercy greatly!" saith messire gawain, "i will do my endeavour in arms the best i may for love of you. </s>
<s> " the younger damsel cometh to king arthur. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she, "my sister hath made her gift and i will make mine. </s>
<s>  i have a suit of arms of gold, the richest that knight may wear, that i will lend you, for methinketh they will be better employed on you than on ever another knight. </s>
<s>  so i pray you that you remember me at the assembly in like manner as i shall ofttimes remember you. </s>
<s> " vii. </s>
<s>  "damsel," saith the king, "gramercy! no knight is there that should see you but ought to have you in remembrance in his heart for your courtesy and your worth. </s>
<s> " the knights were come about the tents. </s>
<s>  the king and messire gawain were armed and had made caparison their horses right richly. </s>
<s>  the damsel that should give the golden circlet was come. </s>
<s>  nabigant of the rock had brought great fellowships of knights together with him, and ordinance was made for the assembly. </s>
<s>  viii. </s>
<s>  the younger damsel saith to king arthur: "well may you know that no knight that is here this day hath better arms than are yours, wherefore take heed that you show you to be good knight for love of me. </s>
<s> " "damsel," saith king arthur, "god grant that i be so. </s>
<s> " so they laid hold on their reins and mounted their horses, that made great leaping and went away a great gallop. </s>
<s>  saith the younger damsel to her sister: "what think you of my knight, doth he not please you?" "yea," saith the elder, "but sore misliketh me of messire gawain for that he is not minded to do as i would have him. </s>
<s>  but he shall yet aby it dear. </s>
<s> " king arthur and messire gawain strike into the midst of the assembly like as it were two lions unchained, and at their first coming they smite down two knights to the ground under the feet of their horses. </s>
<s>  messire gawain taketh the two horses and sendeth them by a squire to the damsels of the tent, that made much joy thereof. </s>
<s>  after that were they not minded to take more booty as of horses or arms, but searched the fellowships on one side and the other. </s>
<s>  nor was there no knight that came against them but they pierced his shield or bore him to the ground, insomuch as none was there that might endure their buffets. </s>
<s>  nabigant espieth messire gawain and cometh toward him, and messire gawain toward him again, and they hurtle together either on other so strongly that messire gawain beareth nabigant to the ground, him and his horse together all in a heap. </s>
<s>  and king arthur was not idle, for no knight durst come against him but he overthrew him, so as that all withdrew them back and avoided his buffets. </s>
<s>  and many knights did well that day at the assembly, but none might be the match of either of them twain in deeds of arms, for, save it were lancelot or perceval, were no knights on live that had in them so much hardiment and valour. </s>
<s>  after that it was evensong the knights drew them back to their tents, and they say all that the knight of the golden arms and the knight of the red arms had done better than they all at the assembly. </s>
<s>  king arthur and messire gawain come back to the tent of the damsels, that make disarm them and do upon them the rich robes and make great joy of them. </s>
<s>  thereupon, behold you, a dwarf that cometh: "damsels, make great joy! for all they of the assembly say with one accord that your knights have done best this day. </s>
<s> " king arthur and messire gawain sate to eat, and right well were they served of every kind of meats and of great cups of wine and sops in wine. </s>
