<s>  of the mourning the king made is there nought to speak, for this sorrow resembleth none other. </s>
<s>  he holdeth the crown of gold, and looketh full oft at the destrier for love of her, for he had given it her. </s>
<s>  and messire gawain may not stint of making dole. </s>
<s>  xxvii. </s>
<s>  "certes", saith he, "now may i well say that the best queen in the world and of most understanding is dead, nor never hereafter shall be none of equal worth. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith lancelot to the king, "so it please you, and messire gawain be willing, i will go back toward cardoil, and help to defend your land to the best i may, for sore is it discounselled, until such time as you shall be come from the graal. </s>
<s> " "certes," saith messire gawain to the king, "lancelot hath spoken well, so you grant him your consent. </s>
<s> " "that do i with right good will," saith the kind, "and i pray him right heartily that he go thither and be guardian of my land and the governance thereof, until such a time as god shall have brought me back. </s>
<s> " lancelot taketh leave of the king and goeth his way back, all sorrowing and full of discontent. </s>
<s>  branch xxii. </s>
<s>  incipit. </s>
<s>  of lancelot the story is here silent, and so beginneth another branch of the graal in the name of the father, and of the son, and of the holy ghost. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  you may well understand that king arthur is no whit joyful. </s>
<s>  he maketh the white destrier go after him, and hath the crown of gold full near himself. </s>
<s>  they ride until they come to the castle that belonged to king fisherman, and they found it as rich and fair as you have heard told many a time. </s>
<s>  perceval, that was there within, made right great joy of their coming, as did all the priests and ancient knights. </s>
<s>  perceval leadeth king arthur, when he was disarmed, into the chapel where the graal was, and messire gawain maketh present to perceval of the golden circlet, and telleth him that the queen sendeth it to him, and relateth also how nabigant had seized it, and moreover, how nabigant was dead. </s>
<s>  the king offereth the crown that had been queen guenievre's. </s>
<s>  when perceval knew that she was dead, he was right sorrowful thereof in his heart, and wept and lamented her right sweetly. </s>
<s>  he showeth them the tomb of king fisherman, and telleth them that none had set the tabernacle there above the coffin, but only the commandment of our lord, and he showeth them a rich pall that is upon the coffin, and telleth them that every day they see a new one there not less rich than is this one. </s>
<s>  king arthur looketh. </s>
<s>  at the sepulchre and saith that never tofore hath he seen none so costly. </s>
<s>  a smell issueth therefrom full delicate and sweet of savour. </s>
<s>  the king sojourneth in the castle and is highly honoured, and beholdeth the richesse and the lordship and the great abundance that is everywhere in the castle, insomuch that therein is nought wanting that is needful for the bodies of noble folk. </s>
<s>  perceval had made set the bodies of the dead knights in a charnel beside an old chapel in the forest, and the body of his uncle that had slain himself so evilly. </s>
<s>  behind the castle was a river, as the history testifieth, whereby all good things came to the castle, and this river was right fair and plenteous. </s>
<s>  josephus witnesseth us that it came from the earthly paradise and compassed the castle around and ran on through the forest as far as the house of a worshipful hermit, and there lost the course and had peace in the earth. </s>
<s>  all along the valley thereof was great plenty of everything continually, and nought was ever lacking in the rich castle that perceval had won. </s>
<s>  the castle, so saith the history, had three names. </s>
<s>  ii. </s>
<s>  one of the names was eden, the second, castle of joy, and the third, castle of souls. </s>
<s>  now josephus saith that none never passed away therein but his soul went to paradise. </s>
<s>  king arthur was one day at the castle windows with messire gawain. </s>
<s>  the king seeth coming before him beyond the bridge a great procession of folk one before another. </s>
<s>  and he that came before was all clad in white, and bare a full great cross, and each of the others a little one, and the more part came singing with sweet voices and bear candles burning, and there was one behind that carried a bell with the clapper and all at his neck. </s>
<s>  "ha, god," saith king arthur, "what folk be these?" "sir," saith perceval, "i know them all save the last. </s>
<s>  they be hermits of this forest, that come to chant within yonder before the holy graal, three days in the week. </s>
<s> " iii. </s>
<s>  when the hermits came nigh the castle, the king went to meet them, and the knights adore the crosses and bow their heads before the good men. </s>
<s>  as soon as they were come into the holy chapel, they took the bell from the last and smote thereon at the altar, and then set it on the ground, and then began they the service, most holy and most glorious. </s>
<s>  the history witnesseth us that in the land of king arthur at this time was there not a single chalice. </s>
<s>  the graal appeared at the sacring of the mass, in five several manners that none ought not to tell, for the secret things of the sacrament ought none to tell openly but he unto whom god hath given it. </s>
<s>  king arthur beheld all the changes, the last whereof was the change into a chalice. </s>
<s>  and the hermit that chanted the mass found a brief under the corporal and declared the letters, to wit, that our lord god would that in such vessel should his body be sacrificed, and that it should be set upon record. </s>
<s>  the history saith not that there were no chalices elsewhere, but that in all great britain and in the whole kingdom was none. </s>
<s>  king arthur was right glad of this that he had seen, and had in remembrance the name and the fashion of the most holy chalice. </s>
<s>  then he asked the hermit that bare the bell, whence this thing came? "sir," saith he to messire gawain, "i am the king for whom you slew the giant, whereby you had the sword wherewith st john was beheaded, that i see on this altar. </s>
<s>  i made baptize me before you and all those of my kingdom, and turn to the new law, and thereafter i went to a hermitage by the sea, far from folk, where i have been of a long space. </s>
<s>  i rose one night at matins and looked under my hermitage and saw that a ship had taken haven there. </s>
<s>  i went thither when the sea was retreated, and found within the ship three priests and their clerks, that told me their names and how they were called in baptism. </s>
<s>  all three were named gregory, and they came from the land of promise, and told me that solomon had cast three bells, one for the saviour of the world, and one for his sweet mother, and one for the honour of his saints, wherefore they had brought this hither by his commandment into this kingdom for that we had none here. </s>
<s>  they told me that and i should bear it into this castle, they would take all my sins upon themselves, by our lord's pleasure, in such sort as that i should be quit thereof. </s>
<s>  and i in like manner have brought it hither by the commandment of god, who willeth that this should be the pattern of all those that shall be fashioned in the realm of this island where never aforetime have been none. </s>
<s> " "by my faith," saith messire gawain to the hermit, "i know you right well for a worshipful man, for you held your covenant truly with me. </s>
<s> " king arthur was right glad of this thing, as were all they that were within. </s>
<s>  it seemed him that the noise thereof was like the noise that he had heard sound ever since he had moved from cardoil. </s>
<s>  the hermits went their way each to his hermitage when they had done the service. </s>
<s>  iv. </s>
<s>  one day, as the king sate at meat in the hall with perceval and messire gawain and the ancient knights, behold you therewithal one of the three damsels of the car that cometh, and she was smitten all through her right arm. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith she to perceval, "have mercy on your mother and your sister and on us. </s>
<s>  aristor of moraine, that is cousin to the lord of the moors that you slew, warreth upon your mother, and hath carried off your sister by force into the castle of a vavasour of his, and saith that he will take her to wife and will have all her land that your mother ought to hold of right, maugre your head. </s>
<s>  but never had knight custom so cruel as he, for when he shall have espoused the damsel, whomsoever she may be, yet will he never love her so well but that he shall cut off her head with his own h and so thereafter go seek for another to slay in like manner. </s>
<s>  natheless in one matter hath he good custom, that never will he do shame to none until such time as he hath espoused her. </s>
<s>  sir, i was with my lady your sister when he maimed me in this manner. </s>
<s>  wherefore your mother sendeth you word and prayeth you that you succour her, for you held her in covenant that so you would do and she should have need thereof and you should know it. </s>
<s>  for and you consent to her injury and loss, the shame will be your own. </s>
<s> " perceval heard these tidings, and sore sorrowful was he thereof. </s>
<s>  "by my head," saith the king to perceval, "i and my nephew, so please you, will go to help you. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith he, "gramercy, but go and achieve your own affair also, for sore need have you thereof. </s>
<s>  wherefore i pray and beseech you that you be guardian of the castle of camelot, if that my lady mother shall come thither, for thereof make i you lord and champion, and albeit the castle be far away from you, yet garnish it and guard it, for it is builded in a place right fair. </s>
<s> " v. </s>
<s>  lords, think not that it is this camelot whereof these tellers of tales do tell their tales, there, where king arthur so often held his court. </s>
<s>  this camelot that was the widow lady's stood upon the uttermost headland of the wildest isle of wales by the sea to the west. </s>
<s>  nought was there save the hold and the forest and the waters that were round about it. </s>
<s>  the other camelot, of king arthur's, was situate at the entrance of the kingdom of logres, and was peopled of folk and was seated at the head of the king's l for that he had in his governance all the lands that on that side marched with his own. </s>
<s>  branch xxiii. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  of perceval the story is here silent, and saith that king arthur and messire gawain have taken leave of perceval and all them of the castle. </s>
<s>  the king leaveth him the good destrier that he won, with the golden crown. </s>
<s>  they have ridden, he and messire gawain together, until they are come to a waste ancient castle that stood in a forest. </s>
<s>  the castle would have been right fair and rich had any folk wonned therein, but none there were save one old priest and his clerk that lived within by their own toil. </s>
<s>  the king and messire gawain lodged there the night, and on the morrow went into a right rich chapel that was therein to hear mass, and it was painted all around of right rich colours of gold and azure and other colours. </s>
<s>  the images were right fair that were there painted, and the figures of them for whom the images were made. </s>
<s>  the king and messire gawain looked at them gladly. </s>
<s>  when the mass was said, the priest cometh to them and saith: "lords," saith he, "these imagings are right fair, and he that had them made is full loyal, and dearly loved the lady and her son for whom he had them made. </s>
<s>  sir," saith the priest, "it is a true history. </s>
<s> " "of whom is the history, fair sir?" saith king arthur. </s>
<s>  "of a worshipful vavasour that owned this hold, and of messire gawain, king arthur's nephew, and his mother. </s>
<s>  sir," saith the priest, "messire gawain was born there within and held up and baptized, as you may see here imaged, and he was named gawain for the sake of the lord of this castle that had that name. </s>
<s>  his mother, that had him by king lot, would not that it should be known. </s>
<s>  she set him in a right fair coffer, and prayed the good man of this castle that he would carry him away and leave him where he might perish, but and if he would not do so, she would make another do it. </s>
<s>  this gawain, that was loyal and would not that the child should be put to death, made seal letters at the pillow-bere of his cradle that he was of lineage royal on the one side and the other, and set therein gold and silver so as that the child might be nurtured in great plenty, and spread above the child a right rich coverlid. </s>
<s>  he carried him away to a far distant country, and so came one early morning to a little homestead where dwelt a right worshipful man. </s>
<s>  he delivered the child to him and his wife, and bade them they should keep him and nurture him well, and told them that it might be much good should come to them thereof. </s>
<s>  the vavasour turned him back, and they took charge of the child and nurtured him until that he were grown, and then took him to rome to the holy father, and showed him the sealed letters. </s>
<s>  the holy father saw them and understood that he was the son of a king. </s>
<s>  he had pity upon him, and gave him to understand that he was of his kindred. </s>
<s>  after that, he was elected to be emperor of rome. </s>
<s>  but he would not be emperor lest he should be reproached of his birth that had before been concealed from him. </s>
<s>  he departed thence, and lived afterwards within yonder. </s>
<s>  now is it said that he is one of the best knights in the world, insomuch that none durst take possession of this castle for dread of him, nor of this great forest that lieth round about it. </s>
<s>  for, when the vavasour that dwelt here was dead, he left to messire gawain, his foster-son, this castle, and made me guardian thereof until such time as messire gawain should return. </s>
<s> " ii. </s>
<s>  the king looketh at messire gawain, and seeth him stoop his head toward the ground for shame. </s>
<s>  "fair nephew, be not ashamed, for as well might you reproach me of the same. </s>
<s>  of your birth hath there been great joy, and dearly ought one to love the place and honour it, where so good a knight as are you was born. </s>
<s> " when the priest understood that it was messire gawain, he made great cheer to him, and was all ashamed of that he had recorded as concerning his birth. </s>
<s>  but he saith to him: "sir, small blame ought you to have herein, for you were confirmed in the law that god hath established and in loyalty of marriage of king lot and your mother. </s>
<s>  this thing king arthur well knoweth, and our lord god be praised for that, you have come hither!" branch xxiv. </s>
<s>  title i. </s>
<s>  here the story is silent of the kingdom, and of king arthur and messire gawain that remain in the castle to maintain and guard it until they shall have garnished it of folk. </s>
<s>  here speaketh it word of the knight's son of the waste manor, there whither the brachet led messire gawain where he found the knight that lancelot had slain. </s>
<s>  he had one son whose name was meliant, and he had not forgotten his father's death. </s>
<s>  rather, thereof did wrath rankle in his heart. </s>
<s>  he heard tell that briant of the isles had great force and great puissance, and that he warred upon king arthur's l insomuch as that he had already slain many of his knights. </s>
<s>  thitherward goeth he, and is come to where briant was in a castle of his own. </s>
<s>  he telleth him how lancelot had slain his father in such sort, and prayeth him right courteously that he would make him knight, for that right fain would he avenge his father, and therefore would he help him in the war the best he might. </s>
<s>  briant made much joy thereof, and made him knight in right costly sort, and he was the comeliest knight and the most valiant of his age in briant's court, and greatly did he desire to meet with lancelot. </s>
<s>  they marvelled much in the land and kingdom what had become of him. </s>
<s>  the more part thought that he was dead, albeit dead he was not, but rather sound and hale and whole, had it not been for the death of queen guenievre, whereof the sorrow so lay at his heart that he might not forget it. </s>
<s>  he rode one day amidst a forest, and overtook a knight and a damsel that made great joy together, singing and making disport. </s>
<s>  "by god," saith the damsel, "if this knight that cometh here will remain, he shall have right good lodging. </s>
<s>  it is already nigh eventide, and never will he find hostel so good to-day. </s>
<s> " "damsel. </s>
<s> " saith lancelot, "of good hostel have i sore need, for i am more than enough weary. </s>
<s> " "so be all they," saith she, "that come from the land of the rich king fisherman, for none may suffer the pain and travail and he be not good knight. </s>
<s> " ii. </s>
<s>  "ah, damsel," saith lancelot, "which is the way to the castle whereof you speak?" "sir," saith the knight, "you will go by this cross that you see before you, and we will go by that other way, to a certain hold. </s>
<s>  haply we shall find you at the castle or ever you depart thence. </s>
<s> " lancelot goeth his way and leaveth them. </s>
<s>  "by my head," saith the damsel to the knight, "this that goeth there is lancelot. </s>
<s>  he knoweth me not, albeit i know him well, and i hear that he is sore troubled of his sorrow and mis-ease. </s>
<s>  natheless, please god, i will have vengeance of him or ever he departeth from the castle whither he goeth to harbour. </s>
<s>  he made marry perforce a knight that loved me better than aught beside, and to a damsel that he loved not a whit. </s>
<s>  and so much might he still better perceive when he saw that she ate not at his table, but was seated along with the squires, and that none did aught for her at the castle. </s>
<s>  but the knight will not abandon her for his own honour, and for that i should be blamed thereof. </s>
<s> " the evening draweth on and lancelot goeth toward the castle, that was right uneath to find and in an unfrequented part. </s>
<s>  he espieth it at the head of the forest, and seeth that it is large and strong, with strong barbicans embattelled, and at the entrance of the gateway were fifteen heads of knights hanging. </s>
<s>  he found without a knight that came from the forest, and asked him what castle it was, and he made answer that it was called the castle of the griffon. </s>
<s>  "and why are these heads hanging at this door?" "sir," saith he, "the daughter of the lord of the castle is the fairest in the world and that is known in any kingdom, and needs must she be offered to wife to all knights that harbour within. </s>
<s>  he that can draw a sword that is fixed in a column in the midst of the hall, and fetch it forth, he shall have her of right without forfeit. </s>
<s> " iii. </s>
<s>  "all these have made assay whose heads you see hanging at the door, but never might none of them remove the sword, and on this occasion were they beheaded. </s>
<s>  now is it said that none may draw it forth, unless he that draweth be better knight than another, and needs must he be one of them that have been at the graal. </s>
<s>   and you be minded to believe me, fair sir," saith the knight, "you will go elsewhither, for ill lodging is it in a place where one must needs set body and life in adventure of death, and none ought to be blamed for escaping from his own harm. </s>
<s>  sir, the castle is right fell, for it hath underground, at the issue of a cavern that is there, a lion and a griffon that have devoured more than half a hundred knights. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith lancelot, "it is evening, nor know i how i may go farther this day, for i know not whither i go sith that i know not the places nor the ways of the forest. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the knight, "i speak only for your own good, and god grant you depart hence, honour safe. </s>
<s> " lancelot findeth the door of the castle all open, and entereth in all armed, and alighteth before the master-hall. </s>
<s>  the king was leaning at the windows, and biddeth stall his horse. </s>
<s>  iv. </s>
<s>  lancelot is entered into the hall, and findeth knights and damsels at the tables and playing at the chess, but none did he find to salute him nor make him cheer of his coming save the lord only, for such was the custom of the castle. </s>
<s>  the lord bade him be disarmed. </s>
<s>  "sir," saith he, "right well may you allow me wear my arms, for they be the fairest garniture and the richest i have. </s>
<s> " "sir," saith the lord of the castle, "no knight eateth armed within yonder, but he that cometh armed in hither disarmeth himself by my leave. </s>
<s>  he may take his arms again without gainsay, so neither i nor other desire to do him a hurt. </s>
<s> " with that two squires disarm him. </s>
<s>  the lord of the castle maketh bring a right rich robe wherein to apparel him. </s>
<s>  the tables were set and the meats served. </s>
<s>  the damsel issued forth of her chamber and was accompanied of two knights as far as the hall. </s>
<s>  she looketh at lancelot, and seeth that he is a right comely knight, and much liketh her of his bearing and countenance, and she thinketh to herself that sore pity would it be so comely knight should have his head smitten off. </s>
<s>  v. </s>
<s>  lancelot saluted the damsel and made great cheer, and when they had eaten in hall, forthwith behold you, the damsel where she cometh that lancelot overtook in the forest with the knight. </s>

<s> " lancelot spake otherwise than as he thought, for the departing of the queen and the sorrow thereof lay so at his heart that never again might he lean upon any love in the world, neither of dame nor damsel. </s>
<s>  he asked his daughter of the knight of the castle, and came before him to save the custom so that he might not have blame thereof. </s>
<s>  and he showed him the sword that is in the column, all inlaid with gold. </s>

<s>  so soon as he touched it, the sword draweth it forth with such a wrench that the column quaked thereof. </s>
<s>  the damsel was right joyful thereat, albeit she misdoubted the fellness and cruelty of her father, for never yet had she seen knight that pleased her so much to love as he. </s>

<s>  natheless, is it no lie that he is one of the best knights of the world, albeit by the stoutness of his knighthood and his valour many an outrage hath he done, and more shall he yet do and he escape you,  so you will believe me, you will never allow him to depart thus. </s>

<s>  for no man is bound to give his daughter to his mortal enemy. </s>
